meta.name: Cyclopean Foundations
meta.description: An 8-part campaign drawing from Lovecraft’s “Call of Cthulhu” and the Eldritch Horror board game.
meta.author: The Beard

cards.name: Lost Moorings
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is equal to the current act number.
[tablet]: –2. If this test fails, take 1 damage.

cards.name: Lost Moorings
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the current
act number.
[tablet]: –3. If this test fails, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
By the time you arrive at the riverfront, the storm has grown to a steady drizzle. Rain pelts the tin roofs and buffets the already cascading waves, some reaching high enough to wash over the docks. 
The worst of the storm has yet to make landfall.
cards.name: A Dark and Stormy Night
Sheets of Rain
cards.text:
A sudden surge in wind brings the approaching storm in force. Rain plasters you all at once, and the gale nearly pushes you off balance. You brace yourself against the storm and push on, determined not to let the weather end your investigation early.
Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Driving Rain and put it into play. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched.

cards.flavor: Amid the downpour sweeping through Arkham, the Miskatonic river grows steadily wilder. A faint saltwater smell lingers on the air as you soldier on, but what could bring such a smell to an inland town on a freshwater river?
cards.name: Churning Waters

Webbed Hands and
Razor Teeth
cards.text:
From out of the water rises a grotesque figure, skin shining from any nearby lights. Its posture and rapid approach clearly show the creature's intentions of attacking you. You scramble to defend yourself against this added menace.
Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Deep One]]or [[Hybrid]] enemy and spawn it at the lead investigator's location (2 enemies instead if there are 3 or 4 investigators in the game). Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched.

cards.flavor: The rain keeps pounding and the fishlike creatures rise from and sink back into the river, but your challenges are far from over. The faint feeling at the back of your mind spikes up strongly, a distant influence that gnaws at your very core.
cards.name: Distant Dreams
Flashes of Nightmare
cards.text:
Your endurance finally peaks between the fearsome attackers, battering weather, and waves of pain inside your mind. You collapse down in agony, unable to keep up your search any longer.
Each investigator is defeated and takes 1 physical or mental trauma (your choice).

cards.flavor: Whether the ship has been hidden or sunk, you won't get any concrete answers about the missing cargo until you can confirm the location of the Myra Louise. A towboat of its size must still be on the river somewhere, and hopefully some witnesses along the Miskatonic's banks can point you in the right direction.
cards.name: The Search for the Myra Louise
cards.text: Objective - When the investigators have the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance.

cards.name: Up the River
cards.text:
There's no shortage of palms waiting to be greased, but you manage to weed out the irrelevant information from the parts that actually point you in the right direction. Several sailors saw the Myra Louise sail into Arkham last night, but it sailed straight through Arkham further upriver without making any stops.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Reveal each [[Arkham]] location, then remove all clues from each location in play. Put the set-aside Main Deck, Wheelhouse, and Engine Room locations into play. Remove the Unfriendly Ports encounter set from the game. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched. This set is indicated by the following icon:

cards.flavor: You trek up the banks of the river west out of town. It doesn't take long before you spot the ship on a small offshoot of the river, anchored in the darkness of nearby trees. While silent, the ship is not uninhabited, and you can spot a lone figure moving slowly and deliberately about the main deck.
cards.name: Marine Salvage
cards.text: Objective - If an investigator enters the Main Deck, advance.

cards.name: Dark Deeds at Work
cards.text:
You move cautiously up the gangplank to the Myra Louise's deck and peer over the railing. On the opposite side, a towering man hoists a body in an expensive suit and hurls it over the side of the ship. You crane your head up to get a good look at the body, but it's just enough for the man to spot you as he turns back toward the ship. "Who the hell're you?!" he bellows, advancing toward you with powerful strides.
Spawn the set-aside Bill Bledsoe at the Main Deck.

cards.flavor: You've found the Myra Louise, and a fresh set of trouble to go with it. The presence of the brutish man and the well-dressed corpse already compounds the mystery, but there's sure to be even more evidence somewhere on the ship. Whatever you choose to pursue, you'll have to work quickly while you can still endure the constant attacks, terrible weather, and strange influence you feel at the back of your brain.
cards.name: Death on the Miskatonic
cards.text: Objective - If at least 3 of the following are true, the investigators may choose to advance: - The investigators "subdued the attacker." - The investigators "inspected the ship." - The investigators "found the cargo manifest." - The investigators "examined the corpses." - The investigators "talked to a survivor."

cards.name: Only Just Begun
cards.text:
Your search of the Myra Louise has provided some very strange insights, but there's no sign of the actual cargo you were hired to find. You decide to retreat with the information you've gathered to figure out where to try next.
(→R3)

cards.flavor: The Miskatonic's waters are especially choppy tonight, and a steady drizzle patters on your outer clothes. If only you could wait a few days for this bad weather to blow over.
cards.name: Waterfront
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You're in no condition to locate that missing cargo right now.

cards.flavor:
The Miskatonic River cuts straight through Arkham on its way east to the delta by Kingsport. There's a lot of 
ground --- and water --- to cover in your search tonight.
cards.name: Waterfront

cards.flavor:
The shipping records are freely accessible, but are 
time-consuming and tedious to examine carefully.
cards.name: Arkham Quay
cards.text: As an additional cost to investigate Arkham Quay, you must either spend 1 additional action or choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
The quay on the south side of the Miskatonic River is where the previous expeditions arrived and offloaded to move the artifacts to nearby Miskatonic University. 
You may find information there about the other 
shipments that Wycliffe financed to narrow your search.
cards.name: Arkham Quay

cards.flavor: On a night like this, you can hardly call them dry.
cards.name: Drydocks
cards.text: While you have no cards in your hand, or no resources in your resource pool, you get +2 skill value while investigating Drydocks.

cards.flavor: You have to consider all possibilities for a missing ship. There's a chance that the Myra Louise was taken into drydocks to get it off the water and quickly out of view.
cards.name: Drydocks

cards.flavor:
Arkham's warehouse managers know better than 
to let random strangers rummage through their stores, 
but there's always a way to make exceptions.
cards.name: Shipping Warehouses
cards.text: [free] Pay 2 resources: You bribe a foreman to give you access to one of the warehouses. Reduce the shroud value of Shipping Warehouses by 3 for the next investigate action performed at this location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Whether or not you can find the ship, 
the expedition cargo is your main target. 
The stolen goods might have been stored in any one 
of the warehouses along the Miskatonic River.
cards.name: Shipping Warehouses

cards.flavor:
All eyes turn to you as you enter the bar.
You didn't expect a warm welcome, but this looks like trouble.
cards.name: The Gutted Trout
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal The Gutted Trout: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Wharf Rat and put it into play at The Gutted Trout (2 copies instead if there are 3 or 4 investigators in the game). Shuffle the encounter deck if it is searched.

cards.flavor:
One of the many dockside bars that line the Miskatonic River. The Gutted Trout has a reputation for hosting 
a rough crowd, which is exactly the type that might 
know something about the missing expedition cargo.
cards.name: The Gutted Trout

cards.flavor:
The sailors loitering around the piers know the ins and outs of the Miskatonic River. Most of them also know 
that valuable information is worth a few bucks.
cards.name: Fishing Piers
cards.text: [action] Spend 1 resource: Parley. Choose any other revealed location. You may either move a clue from that location to Fishing Piers, or vice versa.

cards.flavor:
Long wooden piers line the riverfront where sailors, stevedores, and vagrants often spend their free time. 
If anyone's seen the Myra Louise, there's a 
good chance that they were on these piers at the time.
cards.name: Fishing Piers

cards.flavor:
The stench of death mixes with tarry smoke in the darkened 
boiler room. You can hear the faint scraping and clacking of coal chunks against each other from somewhere close by.
cards.name: Engine Room
cards.text: [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Put the set-aside Tomasz Rybicki into play at Engine Room. [free] If there are no clues on Engine Room: Read Evidence III under Scenario Interlude: Evidence On Board in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
A body lies sprawled at the bottom of the stairs 
leading down to the engine room. In the dim lighting, you're not entirely sure that its features are human.
cards.name: Engine Room

cards.flavor: As you set foot on the deck of the towboat, you get a subtle feeling of vertigo. Something is definitely off about the ship.
cards.name: Main Deck
cards.text: Non-Euclidean – Place 1 clue on Main Deck (from the token bank). [free] If there are 1[per_investigator] or more clues on Main Deck: Read Evidence I under Scenario Interlude: Evidence On Board in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
The Myra Louise sits moored in a 
marshy inlet just upstream from Arkham, 
but its cargo barge is nowhere to be seen.
cards.name: Main Deck

cards.flavor:
The ship's pilothouse shows some signs of 
a struggle, but is seemingly empty.
cards.name: Wheelhouse
cards.text: Investigators at Wheelhouse get -1 to all skills during the mythos phase. [free] Spend 3[per_investigator] clues as a group: Read Evidence II under Scenario Interlude: Evidence On Board in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
The windows of the wheelhouse are broken,
and the door hangs open loosely.
cards.name: Wheelhouse
The Murderous Sailor
cards.text:
The brutish man charges at you with single-minded fury, but you haven't found the missing ship just to cut and run now. His talents prove no match for yours, and within a minute, the man lies on his back on the ship's deck, groaning and clutching his head with both hands. With witnesses hard to come by, you demand that the man tell everything he knows. The man thrashes for a moment, and his eyes snap open with a roar. "The dreamer stirs! In stone it lies dead, with stone shall it awaken!" He spews a series of words that you can't even begin to identify until finally his eyes roll backward and he drops back unconscious, twitching lightly. Is this man possessed? A fanatic? Both? You can only assume that he is a sailor based on his tattoos and clothing, but he is clearly more than that. His work on the ship served some darker power, willing or otherwise.
Add this card to the victory display and remember that you "subdued the attacker."

cards.flavor: The bulky sailor is intimidating, but as blunt as a bull.
cards.name: Bill Bledsoe
cards.text: Hunter. [action] If you are engaged with Bill Bledsoe, you try to take advantage of his recklessness: Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, deal 1 damage to Bill Bledsoe. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - After you defeat Bill Bledsoe: Flip him over and resolve the text on his other side.

cards.name: What the Stoker Saw
cards.text:
After a few tense minutes of reassurance, you manage to calm the stoker, but you find some difficulty in speaking with him. His thick accent and broken grammar show that he hasn't been in America for very long. The man collapses to his seat and rubs his forehead with tearful relief. "You are... save me from them. Men with guns. They say to stand at corner. Not let us talk. I hear sound of them take cargo." The stoker licks his dry lips as he tries to focus his memories. "Boat stop and we wait long time. Then... air turn... waves. Strange sight and sound. Then... monsters come. Fight men with guns. I hide in coal, but... friends not fast." He looks to the bodies of his former crewmates and makes the sign of the cross. You comfort the man and assure him of his safety while making a mental note of what happened to the ship's cargo.
Add this card to the victory display and remember that you "talked to a survivor."

cards.flavor:
The cowering man holds his shovel defensively,
praying under his breath as he tries to judge your intentions.
cards.name: Tomasz Rybicki
cards.text: [action] If there are no enemies at Tomasz Rybicki's location: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, place 1 clue on Tomasz Rybicki (from the token bank). Forced - If there are 1[per_investigator] clues on Tomasz Rybicki: Flip him over and resolve the text on his other side.

cards.name: Drowning Stalker
cards.text: Hunter. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Spawn - Waterfront. Forced - After Drowning Stalker attacks: Move Drowning Stalker and the engaged investigator 1 location towards Waterfront. If Drowning Stalker is already at Waterfront, discard a card from your hand at random.

cards.flavor: The cold November wind and rain leave a terrible lingering chill.
cards.name: Chilled to the Bone
cards.text: Revelation - If there is no copy of Chilled to the Bone in your threat area, put Chilled to the Bone into play in your threat area. Otherwise, it gains surge. Damage and horror cannot be healed from you or assets you control. Forced - At the end of the round, take 1 damage or 1 horror. [action] Spend 2 resources: Discard Chilled to the Bone.

cards.flavor: Is this another dead end?
cards.name: Cold Trail
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, return 1 of your clues to your location and take 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
Something hypnotic calls up to you from
the rhythmic waves of the river.
cards.name: Whispers from the Water
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - At the end of the round, if you are at not at Waterfront: Reveal Whispers from the Water and either take 1 horror or move 1 location towards Waterfront. [action] [action]: Discard Whispers from the Water.

cards.name: Going Twice
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is equal to 4 minus the number of cards in the Auction Deck.
[cultist]: –1. If you fail, lose a resource for each point you failed by.
[tablet]: –2. –4 instead if there are no resources on an Auction Lot card in play.

cards.name: Going Twice
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is equal to 5 minus the number of cards in the Auction Deck.
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, lose a resource for each point you failed by.
[tablet]: –3. –5 instead if there are no resources on an Auction Lot card in play.

cards.flavor: Now inside the auction house, your task truly begins. The O'Bannions are watching the crowds carefully, so you'll have to maintain an alibi.  Bidding on some of the items up for auction should convince them.
cards.name: Cover Charge
cards.text: Forced - If there is no Auction Lot next to the agenda deck: Draw the top card of the Auction Deck and put it into play next to the agenda deck. If you cannot because the Auction Deck is empty, advance this agenda immediately.

cards.name: One Final Bid
cards.text: "Ladies and gentlemen, this concludes tonight's auction." The auctioneer bangs his gavel a final time before stepping down from the lectern, the abruptness leaving the bidders in a slight uproar. The O'Bannions rush through the final transactions and herd the rest toward the exits. With no further business, your presence here will only be tolerated a short while longer.

cards.flavor: With the auction concluded, you have a brief window before your status as a guest is reduced to trespasser. You don't want to test the O'Bannions' capacity as hosts any more than you have to.
cards.name: Sold Out (v. I)
Past Due
cards.text:
Before you can make your exit, a half dozen gangsters corner you with sadistic smirks on their faces. Several of them tighten their grip around blunt instruments as the leader of the pack speaks. "You know what's coming, but I'm a fair man. I'll even give you a head start. You have until the end of this sentence."
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and takes a physical trauma as the O'Bannions "escort" them from the premises.

cards.flavor: With the auction concluded, you have a brief window before your status as a guest is reduced to trespasser. The O'Bannions are particularly eager to evict the auction patrons thanks to the commotion you raised earlier to slip inside, so you'll have to work quickly.
cards.name: Sold Out (v. II)
Past Due
cards.text:
Before you can make your exit, a half dozen gangsters corner you with sadistic smirks on their faces. Several of them tighten their grip around blunt instruments as the leader of the pack speaks. "You know what's coming, but I'm a fair man. I'll even give you a head start. You have until the end of this sentence."
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and takes a physical trauma as the O'Bannions "escort" them from the premises.

cards.flavor: The storage for the gang's stolen goods must be further inside, but security is tight, as expected. There's got to be some way to discreetly clear the door of the gangsters standing guard.
cards.name: Private Access
cards.text: Objective - Only investigators at Auction Hall can spend the requisite number of clues to advance.

cards.name: Someone Else's Problem
cards.text:
As you mingle with the other socialites and criminals, it quickly becomes apparent that the auction has a lot going on beneath the surface. Mixed into the crowds are several dark figures that keep trying to corner and eliminate you, and you're not even sure if they're with the O'Bannions or not. However, between the action, you are able to observe yet another out-of-place figure. Tips from other patrons help you to identify a member of the Sheldon Gang --- one of the O'Bannions' rivals --- casing the auction house. You pass this tip to the O'Bannion sentries, who advance into the crowd, leaving you free access to the back rooms. Duty is one thing, but bad blood is another.
Reveal Service Corridor and put the set-aside Storage Vault location into play.

cards.flavor: You've got to make the most of your time before the O'Bannions tighten their security once more. If the stolen artifacts are anywhere on the premises, then there's only one place to look.
cards.name: Ill-Gotten Gains
cards.text: Objective - If Storage Vault is revealed and there are no clues on it, advance.

cards.name: The Warped Idol
cards.text:
Your search through the auction storage grows steadily more frustrating. Actual tons of artifacts are nowhere to be found, and you keep grappling with some strange force that threatens to eject you from the storage room entirely. As you move to lift another crate, a small bundle slides off and drops to the ground. Your eye catches the word "Mycenae" stamped across the paper, and you immediately seize and unwrap it. Beneath the waxed paper is a curious stone object, about the size of a bottle, carved into an unrecognizable shape. The figurine proves difficult to hold, as its contours do not match up to what you see before you. You don't have much time to examine the object before the sound of echoing footsteps brings you back to the present. There will be time for study later, and there are more unanswered questions to consider.
Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside Warped Idol. For the remainder of the scenario, this asset does not take up any slots. Add a [tablet] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign. Spawn the set-aside O'Bannion Sentry at Service Corridor. Put the set-aside Broker's Office into play.

cards.flavor: The bizarre idol is proof enough of the O'Bannions' theft of the cargo, but the rest of the artifacts have vanished, and you still don't know why the gangsters hijacked the shipment in the first place. You may be able to find answers with the auction broker who handles all the transactions, but you must also consider your safe retreat with the idol in hand.
cards.name: Pursuit of Reason
cards.text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Close the Deal
cards.text:
If there are at least 1[per_investigator] clues on Nora Shanley:
After minutes of pleading and badgering, the woman lets out an exasperated exhale of smoke. "Alright, alright, fine. I've seen a lot of stupid people mess with the O'Bannions before, but this has got to take the cake. I want to hear your reason for all this, and it had better be a good one."
(→R2)
Otherwise:
You make for the exits as discreetly as possible, but the O'Bannions catch sight of you leaving the backroom on your way out. The gangsters look far angrier than you expected, and a bit worn out, giving you a small advantage in the race for the front door.
(→R1)

cards.flavor:
The lobby bustles with hopeful bidders that make it a chore to navigate,
but also provide a constant stream of distractions for the O'Bannion guards.
cards.name: Private Lobby
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You depart while you still can. If the investigators "cooperated with the O'Bannions," Private Lobby gains: "[action]: Test [intellect] or [agility] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on Private Lobby. If you succeed, choose a [[Weapon]] asset beneath Private Lobby and place that card into its owner's hand. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may choose an additional card and place that card into its owner's hand."

cards.flavor:
Despite the supposed secrecy of the event,
 socialites cluster in the lobby by the dozen, 
drawn in by the allure of opulence.
cards.name: Private Lobby

cards.flavor: The vain and shallow gather in the smoking lounge to rub shoulders with those richer than themselves. Perhaps showing off a bit of wealth will encourage them to warm up to you.
cards.name: Smoking Lounge
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (7). You get +X skill value for this test, where X is the cost of the [[Item]]asset you control with the highest cost. If you succeed, gain a clue (from the token bank).

cards.flavor:
A dense haze emitted from dozens of cigarettes and 
cigars blankets the populated room.  Here, bidders 
wait idly for auction lots more to their liking.
cards.name: Smoking Lounge

cards.flavor:
Many of the auction guests fancy themselves as experts 
in one field or another, and are eager to offer their 
long-winded advice to anyone who will tolerate it.
cards.name: Display Room
cards.text: [free] During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Display Room gets –X shroud until the end of your turn, where X is the cost of the discarded card. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
The O'Bannions use this room as a portrait gallery 
for their cover operation, but for the duration 
of the auction, much more expensive and 
exotic items are shown to the bidders.
cards.name: Display Room

cards.flavor:
The auctions proceed quickly and without much ceremony. 
Each bidder knows the legality is questionable to begin with, 
and the O'Bannions collect the asking price immediately 
with armed guards standing by in case of complications.
cards.name: Auction Hall
cards.text: [free] If there is an Auction Lot asset next to the agenda deck: You bid on the current auction lot. Place 1 or more resources on the Auction Lot asset next to the agenda deck (from the token bank).

cards.flavor:
In opposition to the constant chatter and 
relaxed air of the other rooms, the site of 
the actual auction is quiet and tense.
cards.name: Auction Hall

cards.flavor: A long, wide corridor stretches ahead of you with doors lining each side regularly. The stark quietness of the corridor compared to the auction unnerves you to say the least.
cards.name: Service Corridor
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Service Corridor with an encounter card in his or her hand takes 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
There is only a single door leading to the auction 
house backrooms. A pair of brutes even bigger than the outside watchmen stand stoically on either side, 
deterring any but other O'Bannions.
cards.name: Service Corridor
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Service Corridor.

cards.flavor:
Your sudden entrance startles the woman at the desk, 
who looks to you with indignation and confusion.
cards.name: Broker's Office
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Broker's Office, put the set-aside Nora Shanley into play at Broker's Office. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if there is at least 1 investigator at Broker's Office: Move each unengaged enemy 1 location toward Broker's Office.

cards.flavor: Further down the service corridor and around one corner stands a door with the word "Broker" in gold lettering over frosted glass. Another criminal thug, bigger than any two others put together, stands in front of it coolly.
cards.name: Broker's Office
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Broker's Office.

cards.flavor:
Despite the stillness of the storage room, your eyes tell you 
that something is moving. Or is it you that's moving?
cards.name: Storage Vault
cards.text: Non-Euclidean – Lose 1 resource or discard a card from your hand at random (you must choose one). Forced - After you discover any amount of clues from Storage Vault and you did not succeed at investigating by 1 or more (including discovering clues without investigating): Move to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
A ramp leads down to an enormous cellar, 
which once was used for storage of gallery paintings. 
Some paintings remain, but knowing the O'Bannions, 
only stolen or forged ones.
cards.name: Storage Vault

cards.flavor:
The woman's piercing eyes scrutinize you as she considers
whether to cooperate or raise further alarm.
cards.name: Nora Shanley
cards.text: [action]: Parley. You try to convince the broker to give you the information you need. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, place 1 clue on Nora Shanley (from the token bank). Objective - If there are at least 1[per_investigator] clues on Nora Shanley, advance the current act.

cards.name: O'Bannion Sentry
cards.text: Alert. O'Bannion Sentry gets +1[per_investigator] health. Forced - After you defeat O'Bannion Sentry: Reveal Broker's Office. Forced - After you evade O'Bannion Sentry by 2 or more: Reveal Broker's Office. For the remainder of the scenario, O'Bannion Sentry gains hunter.

cards.name: Auction Lot
cards.text: Forced - When the current agenda would advance and this card is next to the agenda deck, remove all doom from play and resolve whichever of the following is true: - If there are fewer than 1[per_investigator] resources on this card, the investigators do notwin the auction. Remove this card from the game. - If there are 1[per_investigator] or more resources on this card, the investigators win theauction. Investigators as a group must pay resources equal to the amount ofresources on this card. If you cannot, remove this card from the game andeach investigator takes 2 damage. Otherwise, remove all resources from thiscard and choose an investigator to take control of it.

cards.name: Auction Lot
cards.text: Forced - When the current agenda would advance and this card is next to the agenda deck, remove all doom from play and resolve whichever of the following is true: - If there are fewer than 1[per_investigator] + 1 resources on this card, the investigators do notwin the auction. Remove this card from the game. - If there are 1[per_investigator] + 1 or more resources on this card, the investigators win theauction. Investigators as a group must pay resources equal to the amount ofresources on this card. If you cannot, remove this card from the game andeach investigator takes 2 damage. Otherwise, remove all resources from thiscard and choose an investigator to take control of it.

cards.name: Auction Lot
cards.text: Forced - When the current agenda would advance and this card is next to the agenda deck, remove all doom from play and resolve whichever of the following is true: - If there are fewer than 1[per_investigator] + 2 resources on this card, the investigators do notwin the auction. Remove this card from the game. - If there are 1[per_investigator] + 2 or more resources on this card, the investigators win theauction. Investigators as a group must pay resources equal to the amount ofresources on this card. If you cannot, remove this card from the game andeach investigator takes 2 damage. Otherwise, remove all resources from thiscard and choose an investigator to take control of it.

cards.name: Auction Lot
cards.text: Forced - When the current agenda would advance and this card is next to the agenda deck, remove all doom from play and resolve whichever of the following is true: - If there are fewer than 2[per_investigator] resources on this card, the investigators do notwin the auction. Remove this card from the game. - If there are 2[per_investigator] or more resources on this card, the investigators win theauction. Investigators as a group must pay resources equal to the amount ofresources on this card. If you cannot, remove this card from the game andeach investigator takes 2 damage. Otherwise, remove all resources from thiscard and choose an investigator to take control of it.

cards.name: Auction Lot
cards.text: Forced - When the current agenda would advance and this card is next to the agenda deck, remove all doom from play and resolve whichever of the following is true: - If there are fewer than 2[per_investigator] + 1 resources on this card, the investigators do notwin the auction. Remove this card from the game. - If there are 2[per_investigator] + 1 or more resources on this card, the investigators win theauction. Investigators as a group must pay resources equal to the amount ofresources on this card. If you cannot, remove this card from the game andeach investigator takes 2 damage. Otherwise, remove all resources from thiscard and choose an investigator to take control of it.

cards.name: Auction Lot
cards.text: Forced - When the current agenda would advance and this card is next to the agenda deck, remove all doom from play and resolve whichever of the following is true: - If there are fewer than 2[per_investigator] + 2 resources on this card, the investigators do notwin the auction. Remove this card from the game. - If there are 2[per_investigator] + 2 or more resources on this card, the investigators win theauction. Investigators as a group must pay resources equal to the amount ofresources on this card. If you cannot, remove this card from the game andeach investigator takes 2 damage. Otherwise, remove all resources from thiscard and choose an investigator to take control of it.

cards.name: Auction Lot
cards.text: Forced - When the current agenda would advance and this card is next to the agenda deck, remove all doom from play and resolve whichever of the following is true: - If there are fewer than 3[per_investigator] resources on this card, the investigators do notwin the auction. Remove this card from the game. - If there are 3[per_investigator] or more resources on this card, the investigators win theauction. Investigators as a group must pay resources equal to the amount ofresources on this card. If you cannot, remove this card from the game andeach investigator takes 2 damage. Otherwise, remove all resources from thiscard and choose an investigator to take control of it.

cards.name: Auction Lot
cards.text: Forced - When the current agenda would advance and this card is next to the agenda deck, remove all doom from play and resolve whichever of the following is true: - If there are fewer than 4[per_investigator] resources on this card, the investigators do notwin the auction. Remove this card from the game. - If there are 4[per_investigator] or more resources on this card, the investigators win theauction. Investigators as a group must pay resources equal to the amount ofresources on this card. If you cannot, remove this card from the game andeach investigator takes 2 damage. Otherwise, remove all resources from thiscard and choose an investigator to take control of it.

cards.flavor: The small man in the corner of the lounge scans the crowd with a predatory gaze. Like a crocodile at the watering hole, he just needs to wait for someone to get thirsty enough.
cards.name: Ernie Vickers
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Gain 5 resources and record in your Campaign Log that your investigator "took out a loan." (Limit once per game).

cards.name: Auction Security
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Most resources. Forced - After the 'hunter enemies move' step of the enemy phase, if there are no resources on an Auction Lot asset and Auction Security is unengaged: Auction Security engages an investigator at its location (according to prey).

cards.name: Pickpocket
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Most resources. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Pickpocket is ready and unengaged: Move 2 resources from each investigator at Pickpocket's location to Pickpocket. Forced - When you defeat or discard Pickpocket: Move all resources on Pickpocket to the resource pools of investigators at Pickpocket's location (distributed as you wish).

cards.flavor:
In the heat of the moment, you might have overbid
while trying to keep up appearances.
cards.name: Bidding War
cards.text: Revelation - If it is agenda 2, Bidding War gains surge. Otherwise, put Bidding War into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When you activate the [free] ability on Auction Hall: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, place 2 additional resources on the current Auction Lot. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 horror. Whether you succeed or fail, discard Bidding War.

cards.name: Covetous Competitor
cards.text: Revelation - If it is agenda 2, Covetous Competitor gains surge. Otherwise, put it into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After you activate the [free] ability on Auction Hall: Take 1 damage. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [combat] (4). You may spend any amount of resources to get +1 skill value for each resource spent. If you succeed, discard Covetous Competitor. If you control an Auction Lot asset, you may remove it from the game to automatically succeed.

cards.name: Keeping Tabs
cards.text: Revelation - If it is agenda 2, Keeping Tabs gains surge. Otherwise, put it into play next to the agenda deck. [reaction] After an investigator activates the [free] ability on Auction Hall: Discard one copy of Keeping Tabs. (Max once per effect.) Forced - At the end of the round, if the investigators did not activate the [free] ability on Auction Hall: Each investigator takes 1 damage and places 1 of their clues on their location.

cards.flavor:
The strange statuette isn't as easy to hold as it looks. Your fingers 
appear to bend around the idol, gripping it from impossible positions.
cards.name: Warped Idol
cards.text: Increase the modifier of each [tablet] token revealed at your location by 1. (Example: –3 becomes –2.) [reaction] When you would move from a location, exhaust Warped Idol: This movement ignores all attacks of opportunity and effects on scenario cards that would trigger from that movement.

cards.name: Private Lives
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of revealed locations with no clues on them
(to a maximum of 4).
[cultist]: –2. If a [[Conspirator]] enemy is at your location, lose 1 resource.
[tablet]: –2. –4 instead if your location is non-Euclidean.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.

cards.name: Private Lives
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of revealed locations with no clues on them.
[cultist]: –3. If a [[Conspirator]] enemy is at your location, lose 1 resource.
[tablet]: –3. –5 instead if your location is non-Euclidean.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.

cards.flavor: The assassins are still somewhere in the manor, but just who are they? They seem to be the same group that robbed the O'Bannions, but if they're not working for Wycliffe, then for whom? Whatever secrets Wycliffe knew, they clearly don't want to be discovered by others, which makes your mission that much more important now.
cards.name: Active Crime Scene (v. I)
The Professionals
cards.text:
Footsteps sound from the front of the manor as a trio of dark suited men enter. They say nothing, but observe for a moment before unpacking weapons and other tools from a briefcase. The other agents within the manor all give them a wide berth with a clear deference of rank as the three men set to work.
Spawn the set-aside Tick Tock Men at Entry Hall. Shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The assassins are still somewhere in the manor, but just who are they? They seem to be the same group that robbed the O'Bannions, but if they're not working for Wycliffe, then for whom? Whatever secrets Wycliffe knew, they clearly don't want to be discovered by others, which makes your mission that much more important now.
cards.name: Active Crime Scene (v. II)
Cleaning House
cards.text:
All at once, a great commotion sounds from the front of the house. Men in dark suits file inside with weapons drawn and other tools at hand. They spread throughout the manor with driven purpose, working to erase everything you're working toward. Your interference has become a priority problem to these men.
Put the set-aside Tick Tock Men into play next to the agenda deck. Shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: These additional agents have sped up your schedule considerably. If you don't deal with them, and soon, then they'll quickly erase everything you've worked to discover --- if not you yourself.
cards.name: Burn Notice
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if Tick Tock Men are at a location with any amount of clues on it: Place 1 doom on Tick Tock Men. [free] As a group, place 1[per_investigator] clues on your location: Remove 1 doom from Tick Tock Men.

cards.name: Never Happened
cards.text:
For the first time all night, through all the commotion and violence, you hear a brief silence. And then, a door slams shut. Footsteps grow louder toward you. Another door slams, and more footsteps join the first. Louder and closer, more footsteps and more slamming doors. You flee the mansion just ahead of a hail of bullets that stream after you, one of them striking your shoulder in the escape.
Each undefeated investigator who has not resigned is defeated and takes a physical trauma.

cards.flavor: Somewhere in Wycliffe's manor lie the secrets to the Mycenaean expedition and your own employment to find the missing shipment.
cards.name: Obituary in Progress
cards.text: Objective - If at least 5 of the following are true, the investigators may choose to advance. - The investigators "studied the architecture." - The investigators "read the news clippings." - The investigators "searched the secret room." - The investigators "found Wycliffe's valet." - The investigators "read Wycliffe's journal." - The investigators "retrieved Wycliffe's letter." - In your Campaign Log, the investigatorsinterviewed the broker.

cards.name: Best Laid Plans
cards.text:
Finally, the fog of deception surrounding the expedition is beginning to lift. With the evidence you've gathered, you make your departure from the manor, sparing one final moment of silence for the murdered financier.
If the investigators found 5 or fewer pieces of evidence in Wycliffe's manor, (→R2). If the investigators found all 6 pieces of evidence in Wycliffe's manor, (→R3).

cards.flavor:
The style of architecture suggests the old and regal
houses of Europe, with a high vaulted ceiling.
cards.name: Entry Hall
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You leave before the assailants can turn their full attentions toward you. [free] If there are no clues on Entry Hall: Read Evidence I under Scenario Interlude: Wycliffe's Evidence in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
Faintly lit by the outside street lights,
the manor's entrance resembles that of a mausoleum.
cards.name: Entry Hall

cards.flavor: The room is welcoming, but the fireplace is strangely spotless.
cards.name: Living Room
cards.text: [free] If you have "found a strange ornament": Put the set-aside Private Study location into play. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are fewer than 1[per_investigator] clues on Living Room: Add 1 clue to Living Room.

cards.flavor:
The room directly adjoining the entrance hall is
a spacious parlor for entertaining guests.
cards.name: Living Room

cards.flavor: The hallway seems to twist to and fro with each step you take. Something about its architecture seems out of place.
cards.name: Second Floor Hallway
cards.text: Non-Euclidean – Shuffle a non-weakness card from your hand back into your deck.

cards.flavor:
A short half-spiral staircase leads up from the entrance
to another ornately designed hallway.
cards.name: Second Floor Hallway

cards.flavor: Wycliffe's manservant is lying facedown on the floor of the simple room with a bloody welt on the back of his head.
cards.name: Servant's Quarters
cards.text: [free] Investigators at Servant's Quarters discard cards from their hands as a group with a total of 4[per_investigator] skill icons: Read Evidence V under Scenario Interlude: Wycliffe's Evidence in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
The door to the valet's room is ajar,
with some faint light glowing near the floor.
cards.name: Servant's Quarters

cards.flavor: Compared to the tidiness of the rest of the manor, the drafting room is stacked with papers, all haphazardly strewn about.
cards.name: Drafting Room
cards.text: [free] If you have 12 or more cards in your hand: Read Evidence II under Scenario Interlude: Wycliffe's Evidence in the Campaign Guide. [action] Spend any amount of clues: Draw 2 cards for each clue spent.

cards.flavor: Wycliffe may have been retired, but he still dedicated one room to be used as his office of architectural business.
cards.name: Drafting Room

cards.flavor: The assassins have already done a cursory search of the bedroom. Anything left here will be well hidden indeed.
cards.name: Master Bedroom
cards.text: [free] If there are no clues on Master Bedroom: Remember that you "found a strange ornament." [free] Investigators at Master Bedroom spend 4[per_investigator] clues as a group: Read Evidence IV under Scenario Interlude: Wycliffe's Evidence in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
The door to Wycliffe's bedroom is wide open,
and you can already see the furniture overturned.
cards.name: Master Bedroom

cards.flavor:
The small alcove behind the fireplace holds a desk filled with diagrams
that seem more like pseudoscience than grounded facts to you.
cards.name: Private Study
cards.text: Non-Euclidean – Reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal a [tablet] or [auto_fail] token, cancel the effects of the move. [action]: Reveal 5 random tokens from the chaos bag. Investigators at Private Study may spend any amount of clues to reveal 5 additional tokens for every 1[per_investigator] clues spent. If you reveal a [bless] or [curse] token, reveal another token. If you reveal 2 [tablet] and/or [elder_sign] tokens, read Evidence III under Scenario Interlude: Wycliffe's Evidence in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor: The ornament from Wycliffe's bedroom screws into place on the mantle and operates as a lever. A safety latch clicks off, and the fireplace glides backward on two short rails.
cards.name: Private Study
Acting on Orders
cards.text:
The final member of the strange group collapses against a wall and slides down to the ground, dead. You catch your breath and scan the darkened corners of the room for more before you calm yourself and begin to search the bodies. On one of the men, you find an opened letter, written on stationery from Wycliffe's own desk, and in his hand. You can only guess whether this letter was sent to the agents' employer or just intercepted by them, but it suggests that Wycliffe was trying to keep them from getting involved in the search.
Add this card to the victory display and remember that you "retrieved Wycliffe's letter." Victory 2.

cards.name: Tick Tock Men
cards.text: Massive. If there are no clues at Tick Tock Men's location, Tick Tock Men gain "Patrol (location with most clues)." Forced - After you defeat Tick Tock Men: Flip them over and resolve the text on their other side.

cards.name: Acting on Orders
cards.text:
The final member of the strange group collapses against a wall and slides down to the ground, dead. You catch your breath and scan the darkened corners of the room for more before you calm yourself and begin to search the bodies. On one of the men, you find an opened letter, written on stationery from Wycliffe's own desk, and in his hand. You can only guess whether this letter was sent to the agents' employer or just intercepted by them, but it suggests that Wycliffe was trying to keep them from getting involved in the search.
Add this card to the victory display and remember that you "retrieved Wycliffe's letter." Victory 2.

cards.name: Tick Tock Men
cards.text: Massive. Tick Tock Men are considered to be at each revealed location. Forced - After you defeat Tick Tock Men: Flip them over and resolve the text on their other side.

cards.flavor: Unlike the other agents here, this man isn't the least bit subtle about keeping evidence out of your hands.
cards.name: Arsonist
cards.text: Spawn - Furthest location from all investigators. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if Arsonist is ready, you must (choose one): - Each investigator at Arsonist's location discards an[[Item]] asset he or she controls or takes 1 direct damage. - Place 1 doom on Arsonist.

cards.name: Cleaner
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [action] If you are at a location with a shroud value of 3 or less: Spawn Cleaner at your location. Forced - At the end of the round, if Cleaner is in your hand: Reveal it, and it attacks you (from your hand).

cards.flavor: The agents seem to know this house inside and out, striking at you from where you least suspect them to.
cards.name: Covert Attack
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty if there is 4 or more doom on the current agenda. If you fail, take 1 damage. If you fail by 2 or more, Covert Attack gains surge.

cards.flavor:
Something isn't adding up 
in the information you've found.
cards.name: Missing Pieces
cards.text: Revelation - If you do not control any clues, Missing Pieces gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [[Conspirator]] enemy at your location. If you fail, place 1 clue on your location for each point you fail by.

cards.flavor:
Wycliffe's papers transition suddenly to a strange code.
Where have you seen this writing before?
cards.name: Obscure Cipher
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Obscure Cipher to the revealed location with the most clues that does not have a copy of Obscure Cipher attached. Attached location gets +2 shroud. No more than 1 clue may be discovered from the attached location from a single action or effect. Forced - After an investigator successfully investigates or discovers clues from a connecting location: Discard Obscure Cipher.

cards.flavor:
Wycliffe's silver ring is engraved with a Latin inscription
circling the outside: "Virtute Silentio Amore."
cards.name: Wycliffe's Ring
cards.text:
You get +2 maximum hand size.
Encounter cards do not count toward your maximum hand size.
[reaction] When an encounter card is added to the hand of an investigator at your location, exhaust Wycliffe's Ring: Draw a card.

cards.name: Crumbling Masonry
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is equal to 4 minus the number of cards in the Traitor Deck.
[cultist]: –2. –4 instead if there is a [[Traitor]] enemy in play.
[tablet]: –2. If this test fails, place 1 doom on the furthest [[Conspirator]] or [[Cultist]] enemy from you.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you have 1 or more encounter cards in your hand, take 1 horror.

cards.name: Crumbling Masonry
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is equal to 5 minus the number of cards in the Traitor Deck.
[cultist]: –3. –5 instead if there is a [[Traitor]] enemy in play.
[tablet]: –3. If this test fails, place 1 doom on the furthest [[Conspirator]] or [[Cultist]] enemy from you.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you have 1 or more encounter cards in your hand, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: Even knowing the evil that lurks within the grand lodge, there is a foreboding atmosphere the moment you approach the doors. Something more arcane than hitmen and cover-ups is lurking inside.
cards.name: Cracks in the Keystone
cards.text: Forced - When a [[Traitor]]enemy would leave play without being defeated: Move all doom on that enemy to the current agenda.

cards.name: Spatial Stirring
cards.text:
If there are 3 cards in the Traitor Deck:
A vibration ripples through the air, not physically harming you but changing the atmosphere ever so slightly. Without your interference, this will likely be the mere beginning of something far worse.
Move this card next to the agenda deck. While it is next to the agenda deck, it gains "Forced - When an investigator would discard any number of cards from his or her deck: That investigator discards 1 additional card."
Otherwise:
With the exposures already beginning, the remaining traitors are keeping their intentions masked. If you weren't considered a threat before, you certainly are now.

cards.flavor: Even though a war is commencing in the very halls of the grand lodge, the Freemasons are still uncooperative and suspicious of you. Is it because of their adherence to tradition, or are they attempting to hide their own betrayals?
cards.name: Schism in Secret
cards.text: Forced - When a [[Traitor]] enemy would leave play without being defeated: Move all doom on that enemy to the current agenda.

cards.name: Profane Prayers
cards.text:
If there are 2 or more cards in the Traitor Deck:
Whispers part the still air of the temple. They are not uttered in any language devised by human minds, and send goose-bumps over your skin at the very sound of their syllables. Now you begin to see the deeper source of this madness.
Move this card next to the agenda deck. While it is next to the agenda deck, it gains "Forced - When an investigator would discard any number of cards from his or her hand: That investigator discards 1 additional card."
Otherwise:
With more of the officers unmasked as infiltrators, you have inspired hesitation in the enemy. Whatever immortal force they serve, they are still mortal servants, and their dark work cannot be completed if you dispatch them all here and now.

cards.flavor: While many of the infiltrators attack you outright, the important members are finishing their preparations to evade you. If you don't finish unmasking these traitors soon, they will escape and leave little for you to trace them.
cards.name: Rapid Erosion
cards.text: Forced - When a [[Traitor]] enemy would leave play without being defeated: Move all doom on that enemy to the current agenda.

cards.name: Back into Obscurity
cards.text:
Another force wracks your brain, like an echo of the first ripple but much stronger, and you feel your psyche being stretched and sheared. You endure the pain for minutes on end until finally you collapse, utterly bewildered. This must have been the final effort from the traitors to incapacitate you and give themselves a further advantage. Unfortunately, it worked.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a mental trauma.

cards.flavor:
An older man with a powerful frame stands just inside the entrance to the temple, glaring at you suspiciously.
He holds a sword in front of him in a ceremonial fashion, but he looks like he wouldn't hesitate to use it. One way or another, you won't gain entry to the temple without dealing with him first.
cards.name: The Tyler of the Grand Lodge
cards.text: Objective - If you have taken a parley action on Luther Lynch, advance. Objective - If Luther Lynch is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Into the Grand Lodge
cards.text:
If Luther Lynch is in the victory display:
With the situation as urgent as it is, you decide that it isn't worth trying to explain yourself. The man could be a cultist, for all you know, and is preventing your passage. After a brief struggle, you render him unconscious and proceed further into temple.
Shuffle the set-aside Cult of Cthulhu encounter set into the encounter deck.
If the investigators parleyed with Luther Lynch:
Something about the imposing man strikes you as being more principled than the assailants you've encountered. You show the man that you mean to help the masonic order and quickly explain some of the threats that you seek to prevent. He looks back to the temple interior in thought before he slowly nods and stands to let you pass. "It is my duty to defend the grand lodge from those who seek to do it harm," he finally utters, "and though you are uninitiated, you will help me perform this duty if I allow you to pass."
Disengage Luther Lynch and flip him to his story asset side. Shuffle the set-aside Cult of Cthulhu encounter set into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: For the organization and resources these conspirators have, one or more of the brotherhood officers must be the traitors. The six highest-ranking members are present tonight performing various duties, which gives you a chance of catching them here and now.
cards.name: Smoke Them Out
cards.text: [free] Spend 3[per_investigator] clues as a group: Draw the top card of the Traitor Deck and put it into play at the location of the story asset with the same name. Flip that story asset and resolve the text on the other side. Objective - If a [[Traitor]] enemy leaves play, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: One Down
cards.text:
If the act advanced because a [[Traitor]] enemy was defeated:
The man collapses down, but one last expression of accomplishment lingers on his face before he expires. These traitors are fanatically devoted to their cause to the point where death means nothing to them. Worse yet, the temple is still rife with saboteurs, which can only mean that there is at least one more traitor commanding them.
In your Campaign Log under "Cultists Killed," record the name of the enemy that was defeated. Remove the corresponding story card from the game.
Otherwise:
Your target suddenly cuts and runs, surprisingly nimbly for his age, and disappears around a corner. You attempt to pursue, but you find nothing but an empty hallway as you round the same corner. Despite his disappearance, his agents continue their attacks on you, which must mean there is at least one more traitor still within the grand lodge giving them directions.
In your Campaign Log under "Cultists Alive," record the name of the enemy that left play.

cards.flavor: One traitor has surfaced, but how many more remain?
cards.name: Next in Line
cards.text: [free] Spend 3[per_investigator] clues as a group: Draw the top card of the Traitor Deck and put it into play at the location of the story asset with the same name. Flip that story asset and resolve the text on the other side. Objective - If a [[Traitor]] enemy leaves play, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Second Strike
cards.text:
If the act advanced because a [[Traitor]] enemy was defeated:
The second traitor falls back with a gurgle, twitching and attempting to summon his strength for one final struggle, but failing. The infiltrators continue to stalk the halls in the silence after his death, which means there is yet another commander to quash.
In your Campaign Log under "Cultists Killed," record the name of the enemy that was defeated. Remove the corresponding story card from the game.
Otherwise:
You can't pin the second traitor down in time before he disappears in what can only be described as a crack in space. The cultist followers still rally inside the temple, which can only mean that there is another rat to sniff out.
In your Campaign Log under "Cultists Alive," record the name of the enemy that left play.

cards.flavor: Just how many of the Freemason elite have been chipping away at its foundations the whole time?
cards.name: Third Degree
cards.text: [free] Spend 3[per_investigator] clues as a group: Draw the top card of the Traitor Deck and put it into play at the location of the story asset with the same name. Flip that story asset and resolve the text on the other side. Objective - If a [[Traitor]] enemy leaves play, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Rule of Three
cards.text:
If the act advanced because a [[Traitor]]enemy was defeated:
With a final blow, the third traitor falls slain, and a stark silence washes over the grand lodge. Without leadership remaining at the temple, the cult agents have no doubt moved on to other pursuits, which leaves you to figure out just what those pursuits may be.
In your Campaign Log under "Cultists Killed," record the name of the enemy that was defeated. Remove the corresponding story card from the game. (→R3)
Otherwise:
The third traitor vanishes, disappearing between ripples of air. Their mastery of the spatial warping power have proved to be an infuriating obstacle, though you find yourself standing in silent halls. The cult has retreated, but where to and for what purpose?
In your Campaign Log under "Cultists Alive," record the name of the enemy that left play. (→R3)

cards.flavor: The temple is often open for guided tours, but only when the Freemasons aren't occupied with their own internal matters. You doubt that this is one of those times.
cards.name: Broad Street Entrance
cards.text: [action]: Resign. This proved to be too much to handle all at once.

cards.flavor:
The grand gothic entrance of the masonic temple boasts of a long architectural legacy. One hundred and fifty years 
of skill and experience went towards its construction, 
and it has stood proudly for over fifty more.
cards.name: Broad Street Entrance

cards.flavor: The foyer gives all appearances of a quiet and stately institution, but it doesn't dispel the air of unease at all.
cards.name: Grand Staircase
cards.text: [reaction] After you enter Grand Staircase: Move to another copy of Grand Staircase. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
The entrance to the temple takes the first opportunity 
to show off the architecture with an ornate 
staircase curling up both sides of an open foyer.
cards.name: Grand Staircase

cards.flavor:
An enormous statue of Benjamin Franklin stands on a pedestal at the back of the banqueting hall. With his role as an early grand master of the lodge, it is easy to see why the masonic 
order would be proud to immortalize him in bronze.
cards.name: Grand Banqueting Hall
cards.text: Non-Euclidean -- Move an unengaged non-[[Elite]] enemy once toward you. If an enemy engages you before completing the movement, it does not attack.

cards.flavor:
Another spacious hall stretches before you, this one
normally available for lavish dinners and events.
cards.name: Grand Banqueting Hall
cards.text: If it is act 1, investigators cannot enter Grand Banqueting Hall.

cards.flavor:
The Persian style of architecture lends the room a mystique of sacred and ancient times. Many such details could be hidden 
in the beautiful designs in the upper arches.
cards.name: Oriental Hall
cards.text: While you are investigating Oriental Hall, for the purposes of counting icons committed to this skill test, [agility] icons count as matching icons, and [intellect] icons count as 2 matching icons.

cards.flavor: The Oriental Hall is the one most often used for ceremonies and events within the brotherhood.
cards.name: Oriental Hall
cards.text: If it is act 1, investigators cannot enter Oriental Hall.

cards.flavor: Most of the offices are unlocked right now, as the Freemasons still have business for the night and expected no prying eyes within their ranks.
cards.name: Temple Offices
cards.text: Investigators at Temple Offices cannot play cards during the enemy phase or mythos phase.

cards.flavor:
Among the general private meeting rooms, 
each of the senior lodge officers have their 
private offices on the first floor.
cards.name: Temple Offices
cards.text: If it is act 1, investigators cannot enter Temple Offices.

cards.flavor: The display cases house statues and objets d'art, but several that could hold larger stones are conspicuously empty.
cards.name: Masonic Library & Museum
cards.text: Masonic Library & Museum's shroud is equal to X, where X is the cost of the topmost card of your discard pile. If the topmost card of your discard pile has no cost or 0 cost, X is equal to 3 instead.

cards.flavor: On the east end of the building, the brotherhood holds a library and museum for historical and archaeological treasures. Some of these could be key to your investigation.
cards.name: Masonic Library & Museum
cards.text: If it is act 1, investigators cannot enter Masonic Library & Museum.

cards.flavor: Masterfully painted portraits line the stairway in yet another display of tradition and pedigree.
cards.name: Grand Staircase
cards.text:
[reaction] After you enter Grand Staircase: Move 
to another copy of Grand Staircase. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
Every inch of the staircase lets visitors know 
the status and ceremony its owners hold.
cards.name: Grand Staircase
cards.text: If it is act 1, investigators cannot enter Grand Staircase.

cards.flavor: The masterful Italian architecture is brimming with symbols, imagery, and icons that could all point to a deeper secret or two.
cards.name: Renaissance Hall
cards.text: While you are investigating Renaissance Hall, for the purposes of counting icons committed to this skill test, [willpower] icons count as matching icons, and [intellect] icons count as 2 matching icons.

cards.flavor: Perhaps the grandest of the ceremonial halls, it gives the appearance of a church within a church.
cards.name: Renaissance Hall
cards.text: If it is act 1, investigators cannot enter Renaissance Hall.

cards.flavor: As Greece is often cited as the birthplace of many branches of mathematics and sciences, it is a small wonder why the Freemasons would emulate its archaic style.
cards.name: Corinthian Hall
cards.text: While you are investigating Corinthian Hall, for the purposes of counting icons committed to this skill test, [combat] icons count as matching icons, and [intellect] icons count as 2 matching icons.

cards.flavor: The Corinthian Hall is the masons' attempt to bring the classical grandeur of Greece to Pennsylvania.
cards.name: Corinthian Hall
cards.text: If it is act 1, investigators cannot enter Corinthian Hall.

cards.name: Luther Lynch
cards.text:
Luther Lynch may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to any investigator at his location
[reaction] At the start of the enemy phase: Move Luther Lynch to any investigator's location. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.

cards.name: Luther Lynch
cards.text: Alert. Luther Lynch gets +1[per_investigator] health. [action] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Parley. You show him evidence of the infiltration here at the grand lodge. [action] In your Campaign Log, if the investigators know the full story: Parley. You explain the entire situation.

cards.name: The Traitorous Treasurer
cards.text:
Glen Conroy pulls a jeweled knife from inside his blazer and raises it threateningly as he backs away. Amid the standoff, he barks to his nearby minions to retrieve hidden caches of valuable weapons and artifacts scattered around the building. His preparations will be a problem.
Move this card next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource on this card from the token bank. If there are 2 resources on this card, remove Glen Conroy and this card from the game.

cards.flavor: The grand treasurer keeps a close watch on all financial and logistical matters within the lodge. These resources could be dangerous if turned against you.
cards.name: Glen Conroy
cards.text: Investigators at Glen Conroy's location cannot gain more than 1 resource during the investigator phase.

cards.name: The Traitorous Deputy Master
cards.text:
Hector Sutton's eyes scan around you, as if focusing on something that did not exist in this reality. He cracks his cane on a nearby pillar and the world seems to fold together at that point, shortening space. Your brain rejects what it sees, but the man is ready to slow you down personally.
Move this card next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource on this card from the token bank. If there are 2 resources on this card, remove Hector Sutton and this card from the game.

cards.flavor:
The deputy grand master is a man of action and 
ambition, but also an intellectual. These qualities could make him a very dangerous potential foe.
cards.name: Hector Sutton
cards.text: The maximum hand size of investigators at Hector Sutton's location is reduced by 2.

cards.name: The Traitorous Secretary
cards.text:
Paul Kellerman slinks back to the edges of the room, signalling his subordinates within the building. The obstacles and attacks against you will be harder to avoid as long as he remains to coordinate them.
Move this card next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource on this card from the token bank. If there are 2 resources on this card, remove Paul Kellerman and this card from the game.

cards.flavor: It is a simple matter for the grand secretary of the lodge to control the flow of information. Is this a habit of professional secrecy or action against you?
cards.name: Paul Kellerman
cards.text: Investigators at Paul Kellerman's location cannot draw more than 1 card during the investigator phase.

cards.name: The Traitorous Junior Warden
cards.text:
Rodney Duvall's posture loosens, but his sharp eyes stay fixed upon you, a glint of malice beginning to rise behind them. His slight smile remains, but he says nothing as he takes a handgun from his coat pocket. He is ready --- eager even --- to end this deception and resume his duty of wholesale murder.
Move this card next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource on this card from the token bank. If there are 2 resources on this card, remove Rodney Duvall and this card from the game.

cards.flavor: The junior grand warden is quietly observant, but has a talent for spotting you among the crowds. Such scrutiny could be a major obstacle if he is indeed against you.
cards.name: Rodney Duvall
cards.text: Investigators cannot move from Rodney Duvall's location on the same turn that they entered it.

cards.name: The Traitorous Master
cards.text:
Ulysses Hill stands proudly as cult agitators around the building all call to him to lead them in prayer. The man obliges at once, shutting his eyes and mouthing foul words which you know in your heart to be profane. This fanaticism fuels your enemies and drives them to horrors you can only guess at.
Move this card next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource on this card from the token bank. If there are 2 resources on this card, remove Ulysses Hill and this card from the game.

cards.flavor:
The grand master is the center of attention in all lodge matters, whether ceremonial, clerical, or otherwise.
Gravitas like this could be an obstacle if he is a traitor.
cards.name: Ulysses Hill
cards.text: Forced - When Ulysses Hill's location is revealed: Place an additional 1[per_investigator] clues on that location from the token bank.

cards.name: The Traitorous Senior Warden
cards.text:
Wallace Thorpe utters unearthly syllables and a faint blue glow begins to emanate around him. The man regards you cautiously, gauging whether or not you will make the first move or if he will, still a patient foe after being unmasked.
Move this card next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource on this card from the token bank. If there are 2 resources on this card, remove Wallace Thorpe and this card from the game.

cards.flavor:
Few men in the grand lodge are as somber and 
tight-lipped as the senior grand warden. Is he a recluse 
by nature or a bearer of forbidden knowledge?
cards.name: Wallace Thorpe
cards.text: Wallace Thorpe's location get +1 shroud.

cards.name: Glen Conroy
cards.text:
Hunter. Aloof.
Each other non-weakness enemy at Glen Conroy's location and each connecting location gets +1 fight and deals +1 damage.

cards.name: Hector Sutton
cards.text: Hunter. Aloof. Hector Sutton's location and each connecting location gain "Non-Euclidean – Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, remove it from the game."

cards.name: Paul Kellerman
cards.text:
Aloof.
Each investigator gets –2 skill value during revelation effects and [action] abilities on encounter cards.

cards.name: Rodney Duvall
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Rodney Duvall attacks (even if that attack was canceled): Rodney Duvall disengages and moves to a connecting location (empty if possible).

cards.name: Ulysses Hill
cards.text: Aloof. Forced - When any amount of doom is placed on another enemy in play: Either place 1 doom on Ulysses Hill or he readies and attacks each investigator at his location (choose one).

cards.name: Wallace Thorpe
cards.text: Hunter. Alert. Forced - After you succeed at attacking Wallace Thorpe by 1 or more: Seal all tokens revealed during that attack on Wallace Thorpe instead of returning them to the chaos bag. [action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, release all tokens sealed on Wallace Thorpe. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Sleeper Agent
cards.text: Hunter. Spawn - Any connecting location (empty if possible). Forced - After Sleeper Agent enters a location: Each investigator at that location chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Cornered Rat
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Cornered Rat to a [[Cultist]] enemy in play. (Limit 1 copy of Cornered Rat per enemy). If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play without a copy of Cornered Rat attached, Cornered Rat gains surge. Forced - After an investigator engages or becomes engaged with the attached enemy: Attached enemy makes an immediate attack. [action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Cornered Rat. This test may be performed by investigators at connecting locations.

cards.flavor:
The lodge officers do not appreciate your presence,
nor your prying into their secrets.
cards.name: Insular Suspects
cards.text: Revelation - Put Insular Suspects into play next to the agenda deck. As an additional cost to investigate, play a card that discovers clues, or activate an ability or effect that discovers clues, spend 1 resource. [action] If there is a [[Freemason]]story asset at your location: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Insular Suspects.

cards.name: Marked (Definite Threat)
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When you enter a [[Cultist]] enemy's location, or vice versa: Reveal Marked (Definite Threat) and place 1 doom on that enemy. [action] [action]: Discard Marked (Definite Threat).

cards.name: Marked (Possible Threat)
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When you enter a [[Cultist]] enemy's location, or vice versa: Reveal Marked (Possible Threat) and place 1 doom on that enemy. [action]: Discard Marked (Possible Threat).

cards.name: Marked (Priority Threat)
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When you enter a [[Cultist]] enemy's location, or vice versa: Reveal Marked (Priority Threat) and place 1 doom on that enemy. [action] [action] [action]: Discard Marked (Priority Threat).

cards.name: Wolves Among Sheep
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [[Traitor]]enemy in play. If there is a [[Traitor]] enemy at your location, treat each [cultist] and [elder_thing] token revealed during this test as [auto_fail] instead. If you fail, take 1 horror. If you fail by 2 or more, place 1 doom on the furthest enemy from your location.

cards.flavor: Square your actions by the square of virtue with all mankind.
cards.name: Compass of the Grand Lodge
cards.text:
[reaction] When Compass of the Grand Lodge enters the play, choose one: Hand, Arcane, Accessory. You gain 1 additional slot of the chosen type.
[reaction] When you play an asset that fills a slot of the chosen type, exhaust Compass of the Grand Lodge: You get +1 to each of your skills until the end of the round.

cards.name: Across Dreadful Waters
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is equal to the current act number.
[cultist]: –X. X is equal to half the amount of doom in play (rounded up).
[tablet]: –2. If this test fails, discard a card from your hand at random.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you have 3 or fewer player cards in your hand, take 1 horror.

cards.name: Across Dreadful Waters
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is equal 1 more than the current act number.
[cultist]: –X. X is equal to the amount of doom in play.
[tablet]: –3. If this test fails, discard a card from your hand at random.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you have 4 or fewer player cards in your hand, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: With the agents of Cthulhu haunting your steps and spread across the world, it won't be long before they're able to track you down and corner you. If you want to reach Singapore, then you'll have to adapt and act quickly.
cards.name: The Reach of Cthulhu
cards.text: (Warning: If this agenda advances, the scenario will end!)

cards.name: The Net Closes
cards.text:
The sound of approaching footsteps fades in as you rush down a side street. From behind, beside, and even in front of you, men in dark suits advance from the shadows. You try to defend yourself, but with their numbers, the agents rapidly overwhelm you.
Each investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice).

cards.flavor: Your ship to the Canary Islands will depart soon, you just have to get to Kingsport harbor to board it.
cards.name: Globetrotting (v. I)
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Kingsport to Las Palmas
cards.text:
You settle down in one of the small rooms reserved for the rare passenger that books a trip on the private steamboat. You hope that the steamer will outpace your pursuers and give you a solid lead to Singapore.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Kingsport]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Kingsport]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Kingsport]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Las Palmas]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 19 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Poisoned Supplies! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: Your ship to Europe will depart soon, you just have to get to Kingsport harbor to board it.
cards.name: Globetrotting (v. II)
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Kingsport to Gibraltar
cards.text:
You close the door to your cabin and collapse onto the bed with a sigh of relief. You can't be sure how many enemy agents are concealed among the passengers, but you have some consolation in your private room.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Kingsport]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Kingsport]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Kingsport]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Gibraltar]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 21 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Harbor Blockade! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: Your ship to Panama will depart soon, you just have to get to Kingsport harbor to board it.
cards.name: Globetrotting (v. III)
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Kingsport to Colón
cards.text:
Cargo ships don't often carry passengers, but you offer the captain more than enough to cover your fare to Panama, and he grants you a spot in the crew's hammocks. It's hardly first class, but you hope your enemies aren't counting on it.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Kingsport]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Kingsport]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Kingsport]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Colón]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 22 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Ambush in the Canal! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: You arrive in the Canary Islands with the expectation of stopping only briefly, but your next ship to South Africa has been delayed due to spoiled rations. You suspect that this not simple misfortune, but you'll have to take action yourself if you want to keep schedule.
cards.name: The Las Palmas Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Las Palmas problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Las Palmas to Cape Town
cards.text:
