Once the local police confirm that the poisoner has been dealt with, supplies are acquired and you set sail with minimal delays. Still, you can't help but wonder how much time this incident bought your enemies.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Las Palmas]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Las Palmas]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Las Palmas]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Cape Town]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 20 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Sabotaged Engines! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: From the ship's deck, you spot the famous rock of Gibraltar at the entrance to the Mediterranean. The liner stops at Gibraltar's port to resupply, but this is where the pleasure cruise finally ends.
cards.name: The Gibraltar Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Gibraltar problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Gibraltar to Port Said
cards.text:
The old sea mines make quick work of the wreckage, blasting the hull apart and clearing the harbor for safe passage once more. You encourage the captain to depart as soon as possible on the off-chance that the cultists have a second tanker ready and waiting.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Gibraltar]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Gibraltar]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Gibraltar]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Port Said]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 21 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Blackmailed Official! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: The placid journey across the Caribbean does not settle your worries one bit, but it does leave you braced for the trouble you find waiting for you.
cards.name: The Colón Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Colón problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Colón to Suva
cards.text:
Finally beaten back, the remaining assailants scatter into the nearby jungle or sink back into the water. You board the next ship south through the canals and hope that you've seen the last of the cult's nearby agents.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Colón]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Colón]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Colón]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Suva]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 23 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Deep Ones Attack! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: For a while, it seems as though your stay in South Africa will go without incident, but mere hours before departure, an explosion sounds within the ship's boiler rooms. Your heart sinks as another hurdle places itself in your path.
cards.name: The Cape Town Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Cape Town problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Cape Town to Zanzibar
cards.text:
You keep a vigilant watch at the harbor while the repairs are made to ensure that no further bombs are planted. This culprit was more careful than the last, as you find no sign of them by the time the engines are fixed. The captain orders immediate departure to not give the bomber another window to act.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Cape Town]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Cape Town]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Cape Town]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Zanzibar]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 20 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Framed for Murder! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: You find smooth sailing once again until you make port in Egypt at the northern end of the Suez Canal. The local port authority has completely shut down the canal for the foreseeable future.
cards.name: The Port Said Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Port Said problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Port Said to Bombay
cards.text:
With the harbormaster's family rescued, he reopens the Suez Canal quickly and quietly. You return to the liner to prepare yourself for whatever trials and tribulations await in India.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Port Said]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Port Said]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Port Said]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Bombay]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 22 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Assassins Close In! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: Traveling across the Pacific compounds your feelings of unease. From what little you know about Cthulhu, he dwells somewhere within the south Pacific, bringing you closer to his domain on this route than any other.
cards.name: The Suva Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Suva problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Suva to Sydney
cards.text:
The seemingly endless horde of monstrous fish creatures finally subsides, leaving the island quiet once again, but for the sounds of storm and sea. You shudder to imagine how many such creatures still lurk in the Pacific, but you are free to continue on your journey for now.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all doom from the current agenda. For each enemy in play, you must (choose one): - That enemy stays in play. Move that enemy to Harborside if it is not already at Harborside. - Discard that enemy and place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at a [[Suva]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). Move each [[Suva]] location with no clues on it and Victory X to the victory display. Remove each other [[Suva]] location from the game. Put each of the set-aside [[Sydney]] locations into play. (Location placement on page 23 in the Campaign Guide.) Put the set-aside Feverish Dreams! story card into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: A sense of unease follows you for the whole voyage to the British territory of Tanganyika.As the ship begins to make port, a terrible scream cries out from just outside your cabin door.
cards.name: The Zanzibar Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Zanzibar problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Zanzibar to Singapore
cards.text:
With the defeat of the actual murderer, you are able to explain to the police just what occurred. Thankfully, they accept your explanation without any complaint and grant you permission to board the next ship to Singapore.
Each investigator at a [[Zanzibar]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). (→R2)

cards.flavor: You disembark at Bombay's docks, wary after the first two stops. As expected, you spot shadowy figures lurking at the edges of crowds and down adjoining alleyways, watching your every move, though in greater number than before.
cards.name: The Bombay Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Bombay problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Bombay to Singapore
cards.text:
The assassins bear down on you time and again, but you beat them back each time, until finally the survivors retreat into the dense backstreets of Bombay. You catch your breath and make for the harbor immediately, hoping the ship is ready to set sail.
Each investigator at a [[Bombay]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). (→R2)

cards.flavor: You have been haunted by visions and nightmares of Cthulhu and cyclopean ruins since your journey began, but the intensity of these dreams spiked tremendously on your first night in Sydney.
cards.name: The Sydney Problem
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if "you have solved the Sydney problem," investigators at Harborside may choose to advance. (Warning: Each investigator not at Harborside will be defeated!)

cards.name: Sydney to Singapore
cards.text:
Exhausted but relieved, you finally are able to rest again. The nightmares still lurk in your psyche, but they won't be enough to kill you outright. Not yet, anyway.
Each investigator at a [[Sydney]] location is defeated and takes 1 physical or 1 mental trauma (your choice). (→R2)

cards.flavor:
Your ship is slated to depart soon, 
but you may still have time to make some extra preparations at Kingsport's shops.
cards.name: Central Hill
cards.text: [action] Spend 1--3 resources: Search the top X cards of your deck for an [[Item]] asset and draw it, where X is 3 times the number of resources spent.

cards.flavor:
You step off the train into Kingsport's 
city center. The smell of the salt sea air 
fills you with both hope and fear.
cards.name: Central Hill

cards.flavor:
"Every ship is a romantic object, except that we sail in. Embark, and the romance quits our vessel,
and hangs on every other sail in the horizon."
--- Ralph Waldo Emerson
cards.name: Harborside
cards.text: [action] Choose and shuffle a non-weakness card from your hand into your deck: Draw 2 cards. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Kingsport manages a surprising amount of 
international shipping for a harbor of its size, 
rivaling even nearby Boston.
cards.name: Harborside

cards.flavor: While fickle and flighty, many of the artists have been affected by strange dreams of impossible landscapes, and could share some insights if you can spare the time.
cards.name: South Shore
cards.text: [free] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Reduce South Shore's shroud by 2 for the next investigate action taken on it (to a minimum of 1).

cards.flavor: Kingsport's southern seafront is the home to many landmarks, including an artists' colony.
cards.name: South Shore

cards.flavor: Since its abandonment as part of the defenses, the fortress has simply been a historical curiosity. The local police would be less likely to suspect anything sinister at work here.
cards.name: Castillo de la Luz
cards.text: Forced - After you place a resource token on Castillo de la Luz, if there are any amount of clues on this location: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.flavor:
The first fortress from the earliest days of Spanish colonization, the stone fort was actively used in defense 
of the city almost to the turn of the century.
cards.name: Castillo de la Luz

cards.flavor: The people at the cathedral keep quietly to themselves, making it a chore to thoroughly question everyone.
cards.name: Catedral de Canàrias
cards.text: Resource tokens cannot be placed on Catedral de Canàrias while there are any amount of clues on it.

cards.flavor:
The basilica is also known as the Catedral de 
Las Palmas and the Catedral de Santa Ana. 
It is a well-known landmark on the islands, 
and its plaza is a common meeting place.
cards.name: Catedral de Canàrias

cards.flavor: Despite the weather, crowds of people still flock to the beach, making it an easy possible hiding place.
cards.name: Playa de Las Canteras
cards.text: [reaction] After an enemy spawns at or moves to Playa de Las Canteras: That enemy gains aloof until the end of the round. (Group limit once per round).

cards.flavor: Playa de Las Canteras is the most popular beach on Gran Canaria, boasting a natural coral sandbar that shelters the bay from the more dangerous waves and currents.
cards.name: Playa de Las Canteras
Poisoned Supplies!
cards.text:
You inspect the rations at the harbor and find that they have indeed been poisoned deliberately. The captain can acquire more supplies easily enough, but he refuses to buy them until the poisoner has been caught. You can't set sail without supplies, nor can you wait on the local police, so you'll have to track down the culprit yourself.
[free] If you are at a [[Las Palmas]] location with no resource tokens on it, investigators at your location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Place a resource token on your location from the token bank. Forced - If there are resource tokens on each [[Las Palmas]] location, flip this card and move it to the active investigator's location.

cards.name: Cult Poisoner
cards.text: Retaliate. Forced - After Cult Poisoner attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand and lose 1 resource. Forced - After you defeat Cult Poisoner, remember that "you have solved the Las Palmas problem."

cards.flavor: While not as important a fixture as it used to be, the castle is still an administrative hub where you might find assistance.
cards.name: Castle of Good Hope
cards.text: [action] Spend 5 resources, plus 2 resources for each clue on Castle of Good Hope: Place a resource token on Castle of Good Hope from the token bank. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
The castle is one of Cape Town's oldest standing structures, having served many functions from 
fortress to town center to military prison.
cards.name: Castle of Good Hope

cards.flavor:
The German firm Adolf Bleichert & Co. is developing a cableway system to more easily scale the mountain.
You might be able to convince their engineers to help you.
cards.name: Table Mountain
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3).  This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on Table Mountain. If you succeed, place a resource token on Table Mountain from the token bank. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
The largest and most iconic of the mountains 
surrounding Cape Town. Table Mountain is a 
popular tourist attraction, recently having 
undergone construction for accessibility.
cards.name: Table Mountain

cards.flavor:
The university is home to some of South Africa's 
most talented engineers, some of whom may be 
willing to help fix the ship's engines.
cards.name: University of Cape Town
cards.text: [action] Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand, plus 2 cards for each clue on University of Cape Town: Place a resource token on University of Cape Town from the token bank. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: The institution was founded almost a hundred years ago as a simple tertiary school, but the financial boom of South Africa's mining industry helped it grow to a full university.
cards.name: University of Cape Town
Sabotaged Engines!
cards.text:
The ship's engineers report that an improvised bomb of some kind destroyed the ship's main drive shaft. Unlike in Las Palmas, this is a problem that could take days, if not weeks to fix. With no other ships heading eastward for some time, you have to find a way to speed up the repairs. You must be careful, however. Whoever sabotaged the engine may still be tailing you.
Forced - At the end of the investigation phase: Flip this card and resolve the revelation effect on the other side as if the last active investigator had drawn this card from the encounter deck. Investigators may spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group to ignore this effect. Forced - If there are resource tokens on each [[Cape Town]] location: Remember that "you have solved the Cape Town problem." Move this card to the victory display.

cards.name: Ticking Time Bomb
cards.text: Revelation - You must (choose one): - Choose an investigator at your location to test [intellect] (4) to defuse the bomb. If you fail, each investigator at your location takes 2 damage. - Each investigator at your location tests [agility] (3) to escape the blast. Each investigator who fails takes 2 damage. Forced - After resolving the effects of Ticking Time Bomb, even if its effects were canceled or ignored: Flip it and move itnext to the act deck.

cards.flavor:
Unsurprisingly, the city's center of bureaucracy
does not take kindly to fugitives.
cards.name: House of Wonders
cards.text: Investigators at House of Wonders must choose two options instead of one while resolving the forced effect on the Framed for Murder! story card.

cards.flavor:
Originally designed as a secondary palace for the 
Sultan of Zanzibar, the building was later converted 
into offices for members of the British government 
who enforced the city's protectorate status.
cards.name: House of Wonders

cards.flavor:
The dispensary provides medications of all variety,
but only to upstanding citizens of course.
cards.name: Ithnashiri Dispensary
cards.text: [action] [action]: Heal 2 damage or 2 horror (or any combination thereof). (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
The dispensary is a well-known landmark of 
Stone Town, constructed with elements of 
Zanzibari, Indian, and European design 
to embody the city's multicultural heritage.
cards.name: Ithnashiri Dispensary

cards.flavor:
The fort may be a public building, 
but there are plenty of places where your enemies could be waiting to ambush you, if you pry too much.
cards.name: Old Fort
cards.text: Forced - After you discover 2 or more clues from Old Fort during your turn: Ready and move an enemy in play once toward you. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
The oldest building in Stone Town, also known as the
Arab Fort due to its construction by the Sultanate of Oman. It has served many functions in the city's history, most recently as a railway terminal.
cards.name: Old Fort

cards.flavor:
There are plenty of restrictions for visitors to
the Sultan's palace, wanted or otherwise.
cards.name: Sultan's Palace
cards.text:
Investigators at Sultan's Palace cannot spend clues.
As an additional cost to investigate Sultan's Palace, either spend 1 additional action or pay 2 resources (choose one).

cards.flavor:
The residence of Khalifa bin Harub, Sultan of Zanzibar.
As the reigning power of Zanzibar, his palace 
is the center of administration for the city.
cards.name: Sultan's Palace
Framed for Murder!
cards.text:
You open the door of your cabin to find the captain, stabbed through the heart with a ritual blade. A crewman at the end of the hallway spots you and runs off, terrified. Things do not look good for you. If you want to prove your innocence and continue on your journey, you'll have to evade the police and track the true culprit yourself.
Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator must take 1 damage, lose 2 resources, or discard 1 card from his or her hand at random (choose one) while escaping the police. [free] Spend 4[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the location furthest from all investigators.

cards.name: Cult Murderer
cards.text: Alert. Forced - After any amount of damage is placed on Cult Murderer: Cult Murderer readies, disengages, and moves to an empty location. Forced - After you defeat Cult Murderer, remember that "you have solved the Zanzibar problem."

cards.flavor:
The verdant gardens provide better cover for 
your enemies than for you, unfortunately.
cards.name: Alameda Gardens
cards.text: Forced - After you discover a total 2 or more clues from Alameda Gardens during your turn: Draw the top card of the encounter deck. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
The lush garden provides a pleasant atmosphere 
with some shelter from the Mediterranean sun. 
It was originally intended for use by 
off-duty troops, but is open to the public.
cards.name: Alameda Gardens

cards.flavor:
Near the point, the British navy has a small stockpile of German sea mines left over from the Great War 
that they've been using for technical training.
cards.name: Europa Point
cards.text: Forced - After you discover any amount of clues from Europa Point: Take 1 damage. [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, ignore the above forced ability until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: The southernmost point of Gibraltar holds the famed rock of Gibraltar, as well as its lighthouse. The mountainous shoreline of Morocco is visible across the straits.
cards.name: Europa Point

cards.flavor: The fortifications hold many secrets, but just as many opportunities for ambushers to waylay you.
cards.name: Tower of Homage
cards.text: Clues cannot be discovered from Tower of Homage while there are any number of enemies at Tower of Homage.

cards.flavor:
The dominant structure of Gibraltar is the tower of the 
old fortress known as the Moorish Castle. It was first constructed by the Berber Empire centuries ago, 
and has stood through several major wars.
cards.name: Tower of Homage
Harbor Blockade!
cards.text:
A few short hours after your liner makes port, a derelict tanker limps into Gibraltar's harbor, barely afloat for the holes in its side. It grinds to a halt on the rocks of the bay, making it impossible for large ships to pass by. You have no doubt in mind that this event was concocted by your enemies, but you can't wait idly for the authorities to clear the ship.
[free] Spend 4[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and resolve the revelation effect on the other side as if the lead investigator had drawn this card from the encounter deck.

cards.name: Sea Mine Detonation
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Sea Mine Detonation to Harborside. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. [action]: Test any skill (2). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. If you fail, take 3 damage. If you succeed, move Sea Mine Detonation to the victory display. Remember that "you have solved the Gibraltar problem."

cards.name: Arab Quarter
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [combat] or [willpower] (3). If you succeed, place a resource token on Arab Quarter from the token bank. If there are 1[per_investigator] resource tokens on Arab Quarter, remember that "you interrogated local thugs." If you fail, take 1 damage. [free] If "you paid for a tip": Remember that "you found the blackmailers' hideout."

cards.flavor:
This district houses much of the city's native 
population. Though originally separate from the 
European Quarter, the recent constructions on the east bank have helped unite the districts of Port Said 
into a surprisingly diverse community.
cards.name: Arab Quarter
Lighthouse of Port Said
cards.text: [free] If "you found a ransom note" and "you traced a criminal contact," investigators at Lighthouse of Port Said spend at least 6[per_investigator] resources as a group: Parley. Remember that "you paid for a tip." Investigators may spend clues during this action as if each clue were 3 resources instead.

cards.flavor:
The lighthouse is one of the harbor's most famous landmarks, making it an easy meeting place. 
Famously, the tower is the first structure in the 
world ever built from reinforced concrete.
cards.name: Lighthouse of Port Said
Suez Canal Company Offices
cards.text: [free] Investigators at Suez Canal Company Offices spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Remember that "you found a ransom note." [action] If "you interrogated local thugs": Parley. Test [intellect] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, place a resource token on Suez Canal Company Offices from the token bank. If there are 1[per_investigator] resource tokens on Suez Canal Company Offices, remember that "you traced a criminal contact." If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: Between the native Egyptian authorities, French developers, and the control of British and former Ottoman governments, the offices of the Suez Canal Company have always been a center of great attention within the port.
cards.name: Suez Canal Company Offices
Blackmailed Official!
cards.text:
You argue on the docks with the harbormaster, but he will not be swayed by any appeal or reasoning. You can tell, however, that he is tense and clammy, and he avoids looking you in the eyes as you speak. The man is in mortal fear of something, but what? Is he being forced to hold you here by the cultists?
Forced - If "you found the blackmailers' hideout," flip this card and move it to the active investigator's location.

cards.name: Cult Blackmailers
cards.text: Forced - When Cult Blackmailers would take any amount of damage, if Cult Blackmailers are ready: Reduce that amount by 1 (to a minimum of 1). Forced - After you defeat Cult Blackmailers, remember that "you have solved the Port Said problem."

cards.flavor:
All kinds of favors can be bought for those
who can find the right people.
cards.name: Gateway of India
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, deal 1 damage to an enemy in play (2 damage instead if that enemy is exhausted). (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
This triumphal arch was constructed by British architects, only recently finished after a decade of construction. 
Its position close to the harbor makes it a frequent gathering place for vendors and tradespeople of all kinds.
cards.name: Gateway of India

cards.flavor:
The old fortifications provide plenty of hiding places 
and side routes to evade your pursuers.
cards.name: Sewri Fort
cards.text: [reaction] After an enemy enters Sewri Fort: Exhaust that enemy.  (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: The Sewri Fort is a series of elongated blockhouses and walls that were used in the city's defense over two hundred years ago. The compound was transformed into a prison after modern defenses made it obsolete, and further converted into warehouses after that.
cards.name: Sewri Fort

cards.flavor: The most frequent prayer to Ganesha is to remove obstacles keeping you from victory, and you could certainly use that.
cards.name: Shree Siddhivinayak
cards.text: [free] If there are no clues on Shree Siddhivinayak: You feel as if your prayers have been answered. Deal 2[per_investigator] damage to an enemy in play. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A temple devoted to the Hindu god Ganesha 
some hundred years ago. Those who seek 
the elephant-headed god's blessings of wisdom 
and success frequently visit with prayers.
cards.name: Shree Siddhivinayak

cards.flavor: The trainyards give you opportunities to injure your enemies or send them off on the wrong train.
cards.name: Victoria Terminus
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy at Victoria Terminus: Deal 2 damage to it or move it to a connecting location.  (Choose one, group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The central railway station of Bombay, 
built to accommodate the city's increasing value as a trading port. More people traverse this station than perhaps any other station in India.
cards.name: Victoria Terminus
Assassins Close In!
cards.text:
All at once, the dark figures begin to converge on your location. With the cultists and their monstrous allies already tailing you, these added assassins could very well overwhelm you. Until the ship to Singapore is ready to sail, you will have to defend yourself against these assailants.
Forced - Flip this card and move it to Victoria Terminus.

cards.name: Cult Assassin
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When Cult Assassin would be defeated: Instead, ready it, heal all damage from it, place 1 resource token on it from the token bank, and move it to the furthest location from all investigators. Forced - If there are 3 resource tokens on Cult Assassin, move it to the victory display and remember that "you have solved the Bombay problem."

cards.flavor: Though not especially experienced, the troops at Fort Davis can help you cull the numbers of the ambushers at the locks.
cards.name: Fort Davis
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on Fort Davis. If you succeed, reduce Cult Ambushers' maximum health by 1[per_investigator] for the remainder of the scenario. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Another military fort, this one south out of the 
town and much more geared toward the training of 
troops for combat in a tropical climate.
cards.name: Fort Davis

cards.flavor: If you can convince the fort's commanders of a vague threat near the canals, then the ambushers might be effectively pinned down.
cards.name: Fort De Lesseps
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on Fort De Lesseps. If you succeed, Cult Ambushers cannot make attacks of opportunity for the remainder of the scenario. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: One of several U.S. army bases lining the Panama Canal.  The fort is an artillery battery first and foremost, though it has some degree of control over the canal operations.
cards.name: Fort De Lesseps

cards.flavor: Between the horrid creatures lurking in the canal's waters, the agents hidden among the buildings, and the cultists lurking off in the nearby jungle, a guerrilla army awaits you.
cards.name: Gatun Locks
cards.text:
Gatun Locks gets +2 shroud while there are ready enemies at it.
[free] Investigators at Gatun Locks spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Automatically evade Cult Ambushers.

cards.flavor:
The canal, famously constructed at the 
turn of the century, allows ships to pass between the 
Pacific and Atlantic without traveling around South America. The Gatun Locks are the northernmost 
set of water locks that make the trip possible.
cards.name: Gatun Locks
Ambush in the Canal!
cards.text:
As you disembark at Colón's port, you catch a glimpse of something moving in the bay --- several of the repulsive fish creatures allied with the cultists. You freeze and scrutinize their movements as they glide upriver. Your arrival surprised the cult's agents here in Panama, but they must be preparing some treachery for you further up the locks.
Forced - Flip this card and move it to Gatun Locks.

cards.name: Cult Ambushers
cards.text: Massive. While there are clues on Gatun Locks, Cult Ambushers cannot be damaged. Forced - After you defeat Cult Ambushers, remember that "you have solved the Colón problem."

cards.flavor:
If nothing else, the cathedral offers a little sanctuary
in the fight against your assailants.
cards.name: Sacred Heart Cathedral
cards.text: [action] [action]: You take refuge within the church. Disengage from each enemy. Enemies cannot engage you until the end of the round. This ability does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor:
The cathedral is a relatively new fixture to the city,
but has already become a sanctuary to the masses.
cards.name: Sacred Heart Cathedral

cards.flavor:
The broad grounds give you plenty of space to outrun 
any enemies that may think to corner you here.
cards.name: Suva Botanical Gardens
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy at Suva Botanical Gardens: Move to a connecting location or move that enemy to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
These lush botanical gardens were built 
on the grounds of the original town of Suva 
after its destruction by rival natives. Recent 
renovations including the clock tower, bandstand, 
and drainage pipes have made it quite popular.
cards.name: Suva Botanical Gardens

cards.flavor:
Being a collecting of knowledge here in the Pacific,
 the library may offer you some insights into fighting 
the mob of repulsive creatures.
cards.name: Suva City Carnegie Library
cards.text: [action] If Deep One Mob is in play, investigators at Suva City Carnegie Library spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Deal 1[per_investigator] damage to Deep One Mob. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor:
The library is one of the city's most prominent 
landmarks, and is a hallmark of the city as 
the cultural center of the immediate Pacific region.
cards.name: Suva City Carnegie Library
Deep Ones Attack!
cards.text:
As your ship docks at Fiji, motion once again draws your attention to the water. Dark figures mass together further out in the ocean, preparing for a massive assault all at once. With nowhere to escape to, you'll have to prepare for their inevitable attack.
Forced - After the third doom is placed on the agenda, flip this card and move it to Harborside.

cards.name: Deep One Mob
cards.text: Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Forced - After any amount of damage is placed on Deep One Mob: Ready it. An investigator at Deep One Mob's location may spend 1 clue to cancel this effect. Forced - After you defeat Deep One Mob, remember that "you have solved the Suva problem."

cards.flavor: With the barracks used for so many different professions, you could more easily search the compound by having a variety talents.
cards.name: Hyde Park Barracks
cards.text:
[action]: Test any skill (3). If you succeed, place a resource on Hyde Park Barracks (from the token bank) and you may repeat this test with a different skill (limit 4 tests per action).
[free] If there are 2[per_investigator] or more resource tokens on Hyde Park Barracks: Place 1 clue on the current act (from the token bank). (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
The sturdy stone buildings have served a surprising 
variety of functions over the past hundred years, including as a prison compound, hospital, immigration depot,
orphanage, legal court, and gold mint.
cards.name: Hyde Park Barracks

cards.flavor:
The proprietors here are always looking to make a profit,
and one of them just might have seen something suspicious.
cards.name: Queen Victoria Buildings
cards.text:
[action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Gain 2 resources. (Limit once per turn).
[free] Investigators at Queen Victoria Buildings spend a total of 4[per_investigator] resources as a group: Place 1 clue on the current act (from the token bank). (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
The cathedral-like structure is in fact an indoor market, housing shops, studios, restaurants, galleries, 
and recreational facilities all together.
cards.name: Queen Victoria Buildings

cards.flavor:
With the vast knowledge stored at the garden, 
it's quite possible that one of the people responsible for amplifying the nightmares is hidden nearby.
cards.name: Royal Botanic Garden
cards.text: [free] Investigators at Royal Botanic Garden spend 3[per_investigator] clues as a group: Place 1 clue on the current act (from the token bank). (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Sydney's botanical garden functions not only as a 
public park, but as a highly respected institute for 
botanic research. The herbarium and library 
attract the attentions of international scholars.
cards.name: Royal Botanic Garden

cards.flavor: With the free flow of information at the terminal, you may be able to piece together the snatches of gossip into something concrete.
cards.name: Sydney Terminal
cards.text:
[action] Spend 1 resource: Draw 2 cards. (Limit once per turn).
[free] Investigators at Sydney Terminal choose and discard a total of 3[per_investigator] cards from their hands as a group: Place 1 clue on the current act (from the token bank). (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: Also called Central Station, the building serves as a hub for travel through much of Sydney. Trains, trams, taxis, and all other kinds of traffic converge here.
cards.name: Sydney Terminal
Feverish Dreams!
cards.text:
Something is amplifying your nightmares, to the point of seriously damaging your personal well-being. You may not survive to board the next ship if you can't find the cause behind these spikes of intense delusions.
Forced - At the end of the round, flip this card and resolve its revelation effect. Forced - If there are 4 clues on the current act: Remember that "you have solved the Sydney problem." Move this card to the victory display.

cards.name: Feverish Visions
cards.text: Revelation - Each investigator takes 1 damage or 1 horror (choose one). Each investigator with a hidden card in his or her hand discards a card from his or her hand at random. Forced - If Feverish Visions would be discarded or leave play: Instead, flip it.

cards.name: Closing the Net
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the act would advance: Reveal Closing the Net, take a total of 3 direct damage or 3 direct horror (or any combination thereof) and discard Closing the Net. [action] [action]: Discard Closing the Net.

cards.flavor:
"I did not forget the marine pursuits of the cult-members in Louisiana, and would not be surprised to learn of secret methods and poison needles as ruthless and as anciently known as the cryptic rites and beliefs."
--- H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthluhu
cards.name: Hidden Needle
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage. If you fail by 2 or more, also lose 1 action.

cards.name: Hot on Your Trail
cards.text: Revelation - Put Hot on Your Trail into play in your threat area. Forced - After you move: Move an unengaged non-[[Elite]]enemy one location towards you. If an enemy enters your location through this effect, lose 1 resource. [action]: Test [agility] (X), where X is your location's shroud value. If you succeed, discard Hot on Your Trail.

cards.flavor: Each new port is a new culture shock.
cards.name: Unfamiliar Territory
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror. If you fail by 2 or more, also place 1 of your clues on your location.

cards.name: Lingering Fatigue
cards.text: Revelation - Put Lingering Fatigue into play in your threat area. Forced - When one of your cards would be removed from the game by a scenario card effect: Take 1 damage or 1 horror (choose one). [action] [action]: Discard Lingering Fatigue.

cards.name: Blood from Stones
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: –X. X is equal to 1 for every 5 Notice in your Campaign Log (rounded down). [cultist]: –2. If you are performing a test against a [[Conspirator]] enemy, you must either take 1 damage or this token becomes –4 instead. [tablet]: –2. If you are performing a test on a [[Paradox]] card, you must either take 1 horror or this token becomes –4 instead. [elder_thing]: –3. –5 instead if you are at a Non-Euclidean location.

cards.name: Blood from Stones
cards.text: Hard / Expert [skull]: –X. X is equal to 1 for every 4 Notice in your Campaign Log (rounded down). [cultist]: –3. If you are performing a test against a [[Conspirator]] enemy, you must either take 1 damage or this token becomes –5 instead. [tablet]: –3. If you are performing a test on a [[Paradox]] card, you must either take 1 horror or this token becomes –5 instead. [elder_thing]: –4. –6 instead if you are at a Non-Euclidean location.

cards.flavor: The angular dome shimmers and flickers with power, distorting even the vectors of light flowing through it. Wherever the barrier intersects with the terrain, buildings bend and shift impossibly, though somehow the structures remain standing.
cards.name: The Geometric Barrier
Architectured Obstacles
cards.text:
Your efforts to break the barrier have not gone unnoticed. One of the renegade architects emerges from the shadows, shifting the spell to counter you more directly.
Spawn the set-aside Barrier Architect at the closest location to the lead investigator without an investigator.
If there are 2 or 3 names listed under "Cultists Alive:"
Alongside the cultists maintaining the barrier, you spy a familiar face from the Grand Lodge in Philadelphia, who no doubt has revenge in mind from your earlier interference.
Choose a listed name at random. Search the collection for the [[Traitor]] enemy with that name and spawn it at the furthest location from all investigators.
Otherwise:
Your earlier efforts deprived the cultists of several capable agents, driving the remaining renegades to a more desperate state of mind.
Attach the set-aside Maddening Designs to Barrier Architect.

cards.flavor: As the cult geometers focus their power, a sudden sound like scraping glass rips through the air. Sections of the barrier begin to fold inward on themselves, slipping from existence entirely and steadily shrinking the size of the dome. Cornered as you are, you cannot afford to be caged even further.
cards.name: Diminishing Fractals
Fragmentation
cards.text:
The scraping and receding barrier seems to lock into place, and with a fantastic display, the shapes all reform, combining and splitting, bending in ways that defy the world you inhabit. The very sight puts a pressure on your mind that you can barely withstand.
In player order, each investigator tests [willpower] (5). Each investigator that fails removes the top X cards of his or her deck from the game, where X is the amount he or she failed by. If an investigator reveals a [tablet] or [elder_sign] token during this test, he or she automatically succeeds instead.

cards.flavor: The brief reordering ends, and the dome continues to close in at an even more rapid pace. Can you shatter it before it closes in on you?
cards.name: Collapsing Patterns
Approaching Zero
cards.text:
The abstract dome rushes downward and inward, closing on you ever faster until the sides and top crash upon you. Your body seizes and your mind spasms from the unnatural sensation, for agonizing minutes until at last, darkness overtakes your vision.
Each investigator is defeated and suffers a mental trauma.

cards.flavor: The longer this dome delays you, the more time your enemies have to prepare their ultimate goal. Your clear goal is to destroy the geometric barrier, but how?
cards.name: Under the Dome
cards.text: Objective - If there is 1 [tablet] token in the chaos bag, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: First Flux
cards.text: Applying the knowledge gleaned from your initial observations, you work out a basic understanding of how the barrier works. As you solidify your theories, the dome begins to wobble, its shape losing consistency. If the mere knowledge of these arcane mechanics is enough to counter the barrier, then there may be hope for you yet.

cards.flavor: The architects' spell seems to rely on using both the knowledge of the spatial warping magic and the will to shape it. You must match their wits and will with your own.
cards.name: Pushing the Boundaries
cards.text: Objective - If there are 2 [tablet] tokens in the chaos bag, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Second Shatter
cards.text: Your understanding of the second principle further weakens the shifting dome. Cracks and splinters begin to cross through the various shapes and patterns, forming lines where the barrier takes longer to morph. Once your knowledge is complete, you will be free.

cards.flavor: You must apply the final leap of logic before the cultists can close the barrier in around you. All that remains is to complete your understanding.
cards.name: To Know is To Be
cards.text: Objective - If there are 3 [tablet] tokens in the chaos bag, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Final Fracture
cards.text:
Your final breakthrough proves to be a literal one, as your discovery of the dome's inner workings unravels it completely. The geometric shapes fold into each other, winking out of existence or dissolving into the stonework of Singapore's landmarks, and leaving you free to leave the city as you will.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: The sprawling docks offer many opportunities to those quick or stealthy enough to safely find them.
cards.name: Singapore Harbor
cards.text: [action]: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, move a clue controlled by an investigator at your location to a story card.  If you succeed by 2 or more, you may instead add 1 clue to a story card from the token bank. (Limit 1 success per turn.)

cards.flavor:
You've only just arrived,
but you have a feeling you won't be staying long.
cards.name: Singapore Harbor

cards.flavor: Self-reflection is a surprisingly taxing task, but the temple offers plenty of support to those seeking to find peace.
cards.name: Thian Hock Keng
cards.text: [free] During a skill test you are performing at Thian Hock Keng, choose and discard a card from your hand: Reveal tokens from the token bag until you reveal an [elder_sign], [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token. Cancel each other token revealed. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: One of the oldest temples in Singapore, originally dedicated to the Chinese goddess Mazu, though it includes shrines to Buddha, Confucius, and many other deities.
cards.name: Thian Hock Keng

cards.flavor:
Much of the barrier's energy seems to be flowing through 
the stone monument. It may cost you, but you may also gain 
some insight into how to break the barrier through it.
cards.name: The Cenotaph
cards.text:
[action]: Search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for a card and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck. (Limit once per round.)
[action]: Shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: A monument dedicated to the citizens of Singapore who lost their lives fighting for the British in the Great War. The tall stone plinth is flanked on either side with memorial plaques listing the names of the dead.
cards.name: The Cenotaph

cards.flavor:
Whether the grand lodge of Singapore has been infiltrated or not,
they won't appreciate your snooping around without good reason.
cards.name: Freemason's Hall
cards.text: Non-Euclidean -- Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token: Take 1 damage or 1 horror. [free] If you control Compass of the Grand Lodge: Parley. Add 1[per_investigator] tokens (from the token bank) to story cards in play, distributed however you wish. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: The masonic brotherhood has arguably existed in Singapore longer than the city itself has. Sir Stamford Raffles, who founded and designed much of the city on behalf of the British Empire, was a well-known Freemason.
cards.name: Freemason's Hall

cards.flavor: The chapel is a place of guidance for the city's citizens, though your problems aren't exactly normal.
cards.name: Convent of the Holy Infant
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, move a clue controlled by an investigator at your location to a story card. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may instead add 1 clue to a story card from the token bank. (Limit 1 success per turn.)

cards.flavor: The complex of buildings was originally dedicated as a school, but has since grown to include the orphanage, refuge, and grand chapel that it is known for today.
cards.name: Convent of the Holy Infant

cards.flavor:
The mosque's architects work with both 
old and new styles, and may be able to give you insight 
into how to counter the cult architects.
cards.name: Sultan Mosque
cards.text: [free] If there are no clues on Sultan Mosque: Move up to 1[per_investigator] clues controlled by investigators at Sultan Mosque to any story cards in play, distributed however you wish. Then, add clues to Sultan Mosque up to its original clue value. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A new mosque designed to celebrate the centenary 
of the community's older, and much smaller mosque. 
The main structure is still under construction, 
but the architects estimate that it should be 
completed by the end of next year.
cards.name: Sultan Mosque

cards.flavor:
Your position may seem ludicrous, 
but if you can prove that you are being hunted, 
the local government may be convinced to help you.
cards.name: The Istana
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Move an unengaged non-[[Elite]] enemy once toward you. If that enemy engages you as a result of this action, discover 1 clue from The Istana. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The Istana is both the residence and office of 
the governor of Singapore. Its design is a combination of classic imperial British designs with the more 
open layout typical of native Malaysian structures.
cards.name: The Istana
Geometric Seal
cards.text:
Seal ([tablet]). Tokens on Geometric Seal cannot be released except by resolving the Forced ability on it.
The impossible angles of intersection draw your notice as you inspect the barrier. Time and time again you have encountered this spatial warping phenomenon, but is there method to it? Only strict inspection of similar events will tell you for certain.
[reaction] After you resolve a Non-Euclidean effect: Move 1 of your clues to this copy of Geometric Seal. (Group limit once per effect.) Forced - If there are 3[per_investigator] clues on this copy of Geometric Seal: Release each token sealed on this copy of Geometric Seal and move it to the victory display.

cards.name: Geometric Seal
cards.text:
Seal ([tablet]). Tokens on Geometric Seal cannot be released except by resolving the Forced ability on it.
You could study the dome for months and not fully catalog each of the rules of nature it appears to break. To weaken the barrier, you must consider the impossible, become familiar with it, and apply this alternative logic to dispelling the dome.
[reaction] After a [[Paradox]] treachery at your location is discarded or removed from play (including discarding it after resolving its effects): Move 1 of your clues to this copy of Geometric Seal. (Group limit once per treachery.) Forced - If there are 3[per_investigator] clues on this copy of Geometric Seal: Release each token sealed on this copy of Geometric Seal and move it to the victory display.

cards.name: Geometric Seal
cards.text:
Seal ([tablet]). Tokens on Geometric Seal cannot be released except by resolving the Forced ability on it.
Even with the bizarre patterns and intersections of the barrier, there is more under the surface at work. Many of the cultists act subtly as they oppose you, and this same careful scheming must apply to the dome. You must learn their methods to challenge the madness.
[reaction] After a hidden treachery at your location is discarded or removed from play (including discarding it after resolving its effects): Move 1 of your clues to this copy of Geometric Seal. (Group limit once per treachery.) Forced - If there are 3[per_investigator] clues on this copy of Geometric Seal: Release each token sealed on this copy of Geometric Seal and move it to the victory display.

cards.name: Geometric Seal
cards.text:
Seal ([tablet]). Tokens on Geometric Seal cannot be released except by resolving the Forced ability on it.
As arcane as this impossible dome appears to be, it still must have been created by human agents. The key to understanding how to unravel the barrier will be in understanding the cultists who created it.
[reaction] After a [[Conspirator]] or [[Cultist]] enemy at your location is defeated or evaded: Move 1 of your clues to this copy of Geometric Seal. (Group limit once per enemy per round.) Forced - If there are 3[per_investigator] clues on this copy of Geometric Seal: Release each token sealed on this copy of Geometric Seal and move it to the victory display.

cards.name: Geometric Seal
cards.text:
Seal ([tablet]). Tokens on Geometric Seal cannot be released except by resolving the Forced ability on it.
The geometric barrier is a work of magic, of that there is no doubt, but you must determine if the underlying principles are the same. The symbols and signs of magic ever-present within the dome must give some clue to breaking the spell.
[reaction] After an [elder_sign], [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token is revealed during a skill test at your location: Move 1 of your clues to this copy of Geometric Seal. (Group limit once per test.) Forced - If there are 3[per_investigator] clues on this copy of Geometric Seal: Release each token sealed on this copy of Geometric Seal and move it to the victory display.

cards.name: Barrier Architect
cards.text: Aloof. Forced - After you activate a [reaction] ability on a copy of Geometric Seal: Barrier Architect attacks you (regardless of location). [reaction] When you defeat Barrier Architect: Gain 1[per_investigator] clues from the token bank.

cards.name: Maddening Designs
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Maddening Designs to Barrier Architect. This effect cannot be canceled. Attached enemy gets +1[per_investigator] health and gains retaliate. Forced - When attached enemy is defeated: Move Maddening Designs to the victory display.

cards.name: Ward Weaver
cards.text:
Hunter.
While Ward Weaver is ready, investigators at Ward Weaver's location cannot move clues to copies of Geometric Seal.

cards.name: Basiphobia
cards.text: Revelation - Put Basiphobia into play in your threat area. Forced - After you resolve a Non-Euclidean effect: Resolve that effect an additional time. (Limit once per effect.) [action] [action]: Discard Basiphobia.

cards.name: Confining Structure
cards.text: Revelation - If there is no copy of Confining Structure attached to your location, attach Confining Structure to your location. Otherwise, it gains surge. Attached location gains "Non-Euclidean -- Take 1 damage and 1 horror." [action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Confining Structure.

cards.name: Fractured Thoughts
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When an investigator at your location would move or add a clue to a story card, reveal Fractured Thoughts and (choose one): - Investigators as a group place 2 of their clues on their locations. - Cancel that moving or adding of a clue. - Take 2 horror. [action] Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Discard Fractured Thoughts.

cards.name: Pulsing Barrier
cards.text: Revelation - Reveal X random tokens from the chaos bag, where X is half the amount of Notice in your Campaign Log (rounded up). For each [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing] and [auto_fail] token you reveal, take 1 damage or 1 horror (maximum 3 total).

cards.flavor: This strange glyph gleaned from the masonic renegades has given you an advantage in keeping the universe in order.
cards.name: Immutable Sigil
cards.text:
[reaction] When a scenario effect would remove any amount of cards from an investigator's hand, play area, or deck from the game: Remove 1 fewer card from the game.
[reaction] If Immutable Sigil would be removed from the game by a scenario effect: Draw it, instead.

cards.name: Pyroclastic Flow
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –2. This token gets –1 for each non-Euclidean effect on your location.
[cultist]: –3. If you fail, remove the top card of your deck from the game.
[tablet]: –2. If you fail, after this test resolves, move to a connecting location.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail and you have fewer than 4 player cards in your hand, take 1 horror.

cards.name: Pyroclastic Flow
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –3. This token gets –1 for each non-Euclidean effect on your location.
[cultist]: –4. If you fail, remove the top card of your deck from the game.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, after this test resolves, move to a connecting location.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail and you have fewer than 4 player cards in your hand, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: The glow of emerging magma dots the disjointed horizon. The cult's work has begun, and already Krakatoa's new volcanic islands are being thrust upward and about like popcorn kernels. Your approach to the center of operations will be all the more hazardous now.
cards.name: Slow Burn
Random Deviation
cards.text:
The atmosphere cracks and shifts, and you can feel multiple fragments of space shifting around you. Something is about to converge on you, but what? Volcanic heat? A gap in space? An enemy lying in wait? You can only trust your instincts and prepare for the first thing you expect.
In player order, name a trait out loud and discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card does not have the named trait, take 1 damage and 1 horror or remove the top 3 cards of your deck from the game (choose one). After each player has resolved this effect, shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: You soldier on through the fractured and molten landscape, though a tension lingers in the air around you. With all the shearing of reality, the building pressure in the caldera's volcanoes may be released without warning.
cards.name: Rising Pressure
Molten Ejection
cards.text:
An explosion rocks the air, and a wave of heat and ash sweeps across you. Scattered chunks of tephra fling across the sky, though their trajectories are disjointed by the overlapping space. It's a matter of chance whether you're in the path of any of the debris.
In player order, each investigator must decide (choose one): - If Warped Idol is ready, exhaust it. - If Immutable Sigil is ready, exhaust it. - Lose 1 action. You cannot move this round. - Reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], [auto_fail], or [curse] token, take 2 damage or discard an asset you control (choose one).

cards.flavor: Space around the Krakatoa caldera is being stretched further apart with each passing second. The architects must be finishing their designs to transpose R'lyeh to the surface. Is it already too late to stop it?
cards.name: Ready to Blow
Rise of R'lyeh
cards.text:
A wave of force rushes out from the volcanic peak, reordering the world around it. The air fragments like shattered glass and you feel yourself pulled in a dozen different directions at once, straining your mind and body with fantastic intensity.
Each investigator is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice).

cards.flavor: Sukiman grips the steering wheel and shouts at you to get on deck. He'll keep you on course provided you can repel the cult agents and act as his spotter through the warped seascape.
cards.name: Fractured Voyage
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there are no [[Voyage]] cards in play: Reveal the top card of the Voyage Deck. Objective - If there are 6 cards beneath Sukiman's Ship, advance.

cards.name: Landfall
cards.text:
Sukiman steadies his ship as you plow through the waves forward, past another intersection of space. Fragments of reality converge in front of you, bringing a towering volcano into view. An island this size couldn't have possibly just emerged from Krakatoa's natural activity, which can only mean that the architects are at work here.
Read Scenario Interlude: End of the Line in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor: Space is bent around the volcano, keeping you from effectively scaling it. Only careful study of the phenomenon and the surrounding slopes will tell if there is a way to bypass the architects' safeguards.
cards.name: Impossible Ascent
cards.text: [reaction] After an investigator is moved by the forced effect on Impossible Summit: Move up to 2 clues controlled by investigators to this act. Objective - At the end of the round, if there are at least 4[per_investigator] clues on this act, advance.

cards.name: Mounting Perils
cards.text:
Through repeated movement around and through the peak, you are able to pinpoint smaller stone fixtures that maintain the warping field. You easily deface the stones, and a clear path up to the peak appears nearby. At the same time that the path appears, an ungodly gurgling roar thunders across the peak, and the sound of leathery wings echoes dully across the peak. Something unearthly is atop the volcano with the architects.
Reveal Impossible Summit. Spawn the set-aside Star Spawn of Cthulhu at Impossible Summit.
If there are 1 or more names listed under "Cultists Alive:"
The traitorous officers gather at the top of the peak, directly overseeing the final construction of their non-Euclidean monoliths. You knew that there had to be a reckoning, and that time has finally come.
Search the collection for each [[Traitor]] enemy listed and spawn each at Impossible Summit.
Otherwise:
With your clearer view of the peak, the stone structures at the top appear more unstable than you expected. Without the leadership and expertise of the masonic traitors, the project has proceeded haphazardly.
Put this card next to the agenda deck. Impossible Summit gains "Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Impossible Summit discards the top 3 cards of his or her deck."

cards.flavor: The architects' magic continues to build, much like the pressure of the volcano. This is your one and only chance to disrupt their ritual, but will it be enough to stop them from raising R'lyeh?
cards.name: Deconstruction (v. I)
cards.text: [reaction] After you reveal a [tablet] token: Place 1 clue on this act (from the token pool). [reaction] When an [elder_sign], [skull], [cultist], or [elder_thing] token is revealed at your location, spend 1 clue: Treat that token as a [tablet] token instead. Objective - If there are 4[per_investigator] clues on this act, advance.

cards.name: Not Written in Stone
cards.text:
After your many experiences with the impossible angles and structures, you are beginning to understand. You find the gaps in the bent space around their stone constructions and deface one of the keystones.
(→R3)

cards.flavor: The architects' magic continues to build, much like the pressure of the volcano. This is your one and only chance to disrupt their ritual, but will it be enough to stop them from raising R'lyeh?
cards.name: Deconstruction (v. II)
cards.text: [reaction] After you reveal a [tablet] token: Place 1 clue on this act (from the token pool). [reaction] When an [elder_sign], [skull], [cultist], or [elder_thing] token is revealed at your location, spend 1 clue: Treat that token as a [tablet] token instead. Objective - If there are 3[per_investigator] clues on this act, advance.

cards.name: Not Written in Stone
cards.text:
After your many experiences with the impossible angles and structures, you are beginning to understand. You find the gaps in the bent space around their stone constructions and deface one of the keystones.
(→R3)

cards.name: Sukiman's Ship
cards.text: While there are any enemies at Sukiman's Ship, it gets +2 shroud. Forced - If an investigator would be forced to move from Sukiman's Ship and there are no connecting locations in play: That investigator takes 2 damage or loses 1 action (choose one).

cards.flavor:
The fisherman's ship is light, but sturdy, 
meant for long voyages throughout Indonesia's waters, 
and able to be crewed by very few.
cards.name: Sukiman's Ship
Cultist Gunboat
cards.text: Revelation - Put Cultist Gunboat into play. [action]: Take a fight action. This test's difficulty is equal to Cultist Gunboat's shroud value. If you fail, take 1 damage. [reaction] After you succeed at a fight action at Cultist Gunboat: Discover 1 clue from Cultist Gunboat. [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move each investigator and enemy on Cultist Gunboat to Sukiman's Ship. Flip Cultist Gunboat and move it beneath Sukiman's Ship, out of play.

cards.name: Emergent Island
cards.text: Revelation - Put Emergent Island into play. [action]: Take an evade action. This test's difficulty is equal to Emergent Island's shroud value. If you fail, take 1 damage. [reaction] After you succeed at an evade action at Emergent Island: Discover 1 clue from Emergent Island. [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move each investigator and enemy on Emergent Island to Sukiman's Ship. Flip Emergent Island and move it beneath Sukiman's Ship, out of play.

cards.name: Basalt Columns
cards.text: Revelation - Put Basalt Columns into play. [free] Take 1 horror: Reduce Basalt Columns's shroud by 2 until the end of your turn. (Limit once per turn.) [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move each investigator and enemy on Basalt Columns to Sukiman's Ship. Flip Basalt Columns and move it beneath Sukiman's Ship, out of play.

cards.name: Displaced Reef
cards.text: Revelation - Put Displaced Reef into play. [free] During a test you are performing at Displaced Reef, take 1 horror: Reveal an additional token. Choose and cancel a non-[auto_fail] token. (Limit once per test.) [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move each investigator and enemy on Displaced Reef to Sukiman's Ship. Flip Displaced Reef and move it beneath Sukiman's Ship, out of play.

cards.name: Sukiman
cards.text: [reaction] After a card is moved beneath Sukiman's Ship, exhaust Sukiman: Look at the top 1[per_investigator] cards of the encounter deck or any player deck. Return them to the top of that deck in any order. Any investigator at Sukiman's location may activate this ability.

cards.name: Wall of Water
cards.text: Revelation - Put Wall of Water into play next to the act deck and add 1[per_investigator] clues to Sukiman's Ship. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. Wall of Water cannot leave play except through the [free] ability printed on it. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase, if there are any clues on Sukiman's Ship: Each investigator takes 2 damage. [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Wall of Water and move it beneath Sukiman's Ship, out of play.

cards.name: Intersecting Seas
cards.text: Revelation - Put Intersecting Seas into play next to the act deck and add 1[per_investigator] clues to Sukiman's Ship. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. Intersecting Seas cannot leave play except through the [free] ability printed on it. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase, if there are any clues on Sukiman's Ship: Each investigator loses 3 resources. [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Intersecting Seas and move it beneath Sukiman's Ship, out of play.

cards.name: Vertical Seascape
cards.text: Revelation - Put Vertical Seascape into play next to the act deck and add 1[per_investigator] clues to Sukiman's Ship. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. Vertical Seascape cannot leave play except through the [free] ability printed on it. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase, if there are any clues on Sukiman's Ship: Each investigator takes 2 horror. [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Vertical Seascape and move it beneath Sukiman's Ship, out of play.

cards.name: Coiling Waves
cards.text: Revelation - Put Coiling Waves into play next to the act deck and add 1[per_investigator] clues to Sukiman's Ship. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. Coiling Waves cannot leave play except through the [free] ability printed on it. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase, if there are any clues on Sukiman's Ship: Each investigator discards the top 3 cards of his or her deck. [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Coiling Waves and move it beneath Sukiman's Ship, out of play.

cards.flavor: You must bring down the architects' creations!
cards.name: Impossible Summit
cards.text: Non-Euclidean -- Resolve each non-Euclidean effect on the location you would move to. [action] Exhaust an asset you control with a printed fight action: Reveal X random tokens from the chaos bag, where X is the maximum possible damage that asset is able to deal. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor: Spires of crooked stone rise from the top of the peak, but each path up the side of the volcano seems to fold around it.
cards.name: Impossible Summit
cards.text: Forced - When you would move to Impossible Summit: Engage each enemy at Impossible Summit and move to the location directly across Impossible Summit from your starting location. Gain 1 clue from the token bank for each enemy engaged this way. Do not reveal Impossible Summit.

cards.name: River of Lava
cards.text: River of Lava is connected to each location above, below, to the left, and to the right of it. Non-Euclidean -- If there are any amount of clues on your location, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: Each facet of the volcano is a dangerous mess, but could they hold the key to breaking the cult's wards?
cards.name: Twisted Caldera
cards.text: Twisted Caldera is connected to each location above, below, to the left, and to the right of it.
