cards.flavor: The peak looms in the distance, its appearance shifting constantly from the fractured spaces cycling, giving you added perspective.
cards.name: Volcanic Shore
cards.text:
Volcanic Shore is connected to the location above it.
[action]: Choose a card that has been removed from the game (but not exiled) and shuffle it back into its owner's deck. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
The rocky slope dips unevenly into the sea,
freshly hardened from lava floes.
cards.name: Volcanic Shore
Star Spawn of Cthulhu
cards.text: Hunter. Alert. Forced - When an [elder_sign] or [tablet] token is revealed at Star Spawn of Cthulhu's location: Treat that token as a [elder_thing] token instead.

cards.name: Agent of the Deep
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Agent of the Deep gets +1 fight and +1 damage if you have 10 or more Notice in the Campaign Log, and +1 fight and +1 evade if you have 20 or more Notice in the Campaign Log.

cards.name: Clouds of Ash
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Clouds of Ash to your location. Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at the attached location takes 1 damage or places 1 of their clues on their location (choose one). [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, discard Clouds of Ash. If you fail, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Haphazard Convergence
cards.text: Revelation - Put Haphazard Convergence into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not move during your turn: Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, take 2 horror. [action] As your first action: Discard Haphazard Convergence. You cannot take move actions during your turn.

cards.name: Rain of Cinders
cards.text: Revelation - Put Rain of Cinders into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not move during your turn: Test [agility] (4). If you fail, take 2 damage. [action] As your first action: Discard Rain of Cinders. You cannot take move actions during your turn.

cards.name: Spatial Ward
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Spatial Ward to the location that is connected to the most other locations and does not have a copy of Spatial Ward attached. If there are no connecting locations in play, Spatial Ward gains surge. Investigators cannot move to the attached location through normal actions or player effects. Each connecting location gains "[action] Take 1 horror or place 1 of your clues on your location: Discard Spatial Ward."

cards.name: Tomb of Dead Dreams
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is equal to 1 plus the number of Inescapable Reach cards in play.
[cultist]: –3. If the orientation of your location and your investigator mini-card do not match, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, after this test resolves, rotate your investigator mini-card 90 degrees clockwise or counter-clockwise.
[elder_thing]: –3. If Cthulhu is at your location, this test automatically fails instead.

cards.name: Tomb of Dead Dreams
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is equal to 2 plus the number of Inescapable Reach cards in play.
[cultist]: –4. If the orientation of your location and your investigator mini-card do not match, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail, after this test resolves, rotate your investigator mini-card 90 degrees clockwise or counter-clockwise.
[elder_thing]: –4. If Cthulhu is at your location, this test automatically fails instead.

cards.flavor: You tread in the domain of the dead dreamer Cthulhu. How long will it be until he awakens?  You have no recourse but to work quicker than you ever have before, and hope beyond hope.
cards.name: The Dead God Stirs
cards.text:
Clues cannot be discovered from [[R'lyeh]]  locations whose orientation does not match the orientation of your investigator mini-card.
Each location is connected to each other location during the enemy phase.

cards.name: Awoken From Death
cards.text:
A grinding sound reverberates throughout the island, the deep but shrill scraping of stone against stone. Through the inconstant landscape rises a titanic figure, the only thing clearly visible on the island from any angle. Its arms and wings raise as its booming voice carries terror through the air with it. The lord of R'lyeh has awoken.
Spawn the set-aside Cthulhu next to the agenda deck. Place each of the set-aside copies of Inescapable Reach next to the agenda deck, facedown. Place 1 horror on agenda 2a.

cards.flavor: The terrible squid-dragon bears down on you, but the warped terrain of R'lyeh makes it difficult to see just where and when it will strike at you.
cards.name: The Great Dreamer's Pursuit
cards.text: Clues cannot be discovered from [[R'lyeh]] locations whose orientation does not match the orientation of your investigator mini-card. Each location is connected to each other location during the enemy phase. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Shuffle each facedown copy of Inescapable Reach together and flip X of them faceup, where X is equal to the amount of horror on this agenda.

cards.name: Master of Broken Space
cards.text:
If there is fewer than 3 horror on this agenda:
The pursuit drags on, and each moment brings the creature's thundering stride and lumbering grasp closer.
Place 1 horror on this agenda. Flip back to agenda 2a.
Otherwise:
As R'lyeh's angles swallow and shift everything that touch them, the island seems to open up around Cthulhu. It is lord here, and you are trespassers in its unearthly domain.
Advance to agenda 3a.

cards.flavor: Terror courses through your body, pushing you onward, for if you falter, you already know the dire consequence. Cthulhu has set its terrible sight upon you and it will not be denied.
cards.name: Dread Manifest
cards.text: Clues cannot be discovered from [[R'lyeh]] locations whose orientation does not match the orientation of your investigator mini-card. Each location is connected to each other location during the enemy phase. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Flip each facedown copy of Inescapable Reach faceup.

cards.name: Insurmountable
cards.text:
There is no escape now. Cthulhu's webbed claws sweep down, mauling you savagely and scoring your mind with its unearthly voice. This accursed island was once its tomb, but now it shall be yours.
(→R1)

cards.flavor: To find and destroy the pillars holding R'lyeh at the surface, you will first have to explore the island to make sense of its impossible perspectives.
cards.name: Cyclopean Landscape
cards.text: [action]: Rotate your investigator mini-card 90 degrees clockwise or counter-clockwise. Any investigator may place 1 of their clues on their location to reduce this ability's cost by 1 action (to a [free] ability instead). [reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Gain a clue from the token bank. [free] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Choose and reveal 2 Warped Island locations in play. Objective - If each Warped Island location is revealed, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: The Non-Euclidean Pillars
cards.text:
After all that you have seen, you are surprised to find some method to the madness at hand. The perspectives make sense in highly specific circumstances, impossible to truly comprehend, but like advanced scientific theories still work in practice. Through much trial and error, you finally can make your way to the bases of these pillars.
Put each set-aside copy of Impossible Pillar into play in the following orientations (in order, until each Impossible Pillar is in play): Down, Right, Left, Up.

cards.flavor: These pillars --- made in imitation of the unknowable --- must be toppled. Only once they lie in broken ruin can this unnatural place return to whence it came.
cards.name: Reverse Architectured
cards.text: [action]: Rotate your investigator mini-card 90 degrees clockwise or counter-clockwise. Any investigator may place 1 of their clues on their location to reduce this ability's cost by 1 action (to a [free] ability instead). Each [[R'lyeh]] location gains "Non-Euclidean -- Place 1 horror on this location." [reaction] After you move to a location, if the orientation of your investigator-mini card matches that location: Take a move action. (Limit 3 times per turn.) Objective - When a story card enters the victory display, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Spatial Collapse
cards.text:
If there are 1 or more Impossible Pillars in play:
As the pillar crumbles and folds out of existence, space buckles and the island seems to turn on its end. You dig your fingers into the soapy rock and pray that you're still right side up when the distortion recedes.
Flip back to act 2a.
Otherwise:
The final pillar cracks and dissolves into the fragmented atmosphere with a hollow echo. Air and water rush in and around from all sides in a complete reversal of the event that brought R'lyeh to the surface. The sky spins one direction and the ground in the opposite, but through it all you see the figure of Cthulhu reaching towards you in dark fury.
(→R4)

cards.flavor:
Navigating the island takes every fiber of your 
concentration. The looming monoliths and deep sea flora 
mix, overlap, and intersect without rhyme or reason.
cards.name: Ruins of R'lyeh
cards.text: Non-Euclidean -- Shuffle your deck. [action]: Move directly to a revealed copy of Warped Island. [action]: Move directly to Ruins of R'lyeh. Investigators at any copy of Warped Island may activate this ability.

cards.flavor:
"Johansen and his men were awed by the cosmic 
majesty of this dripping Babylon of elder daemons, 
and must have guessed without guidance that it 
was nothing of this or of any sane planet."
--- H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthulhu
cards.name: Ruins of R'lyeh

cards.flavor: The sheer scale of the monolithic ruin fills you with dread.
cards.name: Cyclopean Acropolis
cards.text: Non-Euclidean -- Take 1 damage or 1 horror. [action]: Move to any revealed location. After this movement concludes, you may rotate your investigator mini-card to any orientation.

cards.flavor:
"The rest followed him, and looked curiously at the immense carved door with the now familiar squid-dragon bas-relief. It was, Johansen said, like a great barn-door;"
--- H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthluhu
cards.name: Cyclopean Acropolis
Warped Island
cards.text: Warped Island is connected to each other revealed [[R'lyeh]] location in play that is oriented Up. Non-Euclidean -- Rotate your investigator mini-card 90 degrees clockwise or discard the top card of your deck (choose one).

cards.flavor:
"...vast angles and stone surfaces — surfaces too great to belong to any thing right or proper for this earth, and impious with horrible images and hieroglyphs."
--- H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthluhu
cards.name: Warped Island
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Warped Island.

cards.name: Warped Island
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Warped Island.

cards.name: The Ethereal Pillar
cards.text:
The world around this pillar seems to be completely out of phase. Only when you strain your mind to its limit does the pillar overlap with the island.
Choose an investigator at this location to test [willpower] + [intellect] (4). This test gets +2[per_investigator] difficulty. An investigator at this location may exhaust Warped Idol or Immutable Sigil to give +2 skill value for this test.
If this test failed:
You can feel your mind twisting as you attempt to attune yourself to the pillar, triggering intense agony in your brain.
Each investigator at this location takes 1 horror. The performing investigator takes 1 additional horror. Proceed to If this test succeeded.
If this test succeeded:
You continue to focus your mind for several intense minutes, keeping fixated on the pillar long enough for you to approach it and dislodge an unstable fragment.
Discard each card attached to this location and move this card to the victory display. Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Ruins of R'lyeh.

cards.name: Impossible Pillar
cards.text:
Impossible Pillar is connected to each other location with the same orientation as itself, and vice versa.
[action] Remove 2 horror from among other locations with the same orientation as Impossible Pillar: Discover a clue from Impossible Pillar.
[free] If there are no clues on Impossible Pillar: Flip it and resolve the story text on its other side.

cards.name: The Distorted Pillar
cards.text:
The island has twisted nearly upside down at the site of this pillar. It will take all of your fortitude to perceive and climb the rock face, both physically and mentally.
Choose an investigator at this location to test [willpower] + [combat] (4). This test gets +2[per_investigator] difficulty. An investigator at this location may exhaust Warped Idol or Immutable Sigil to give +2 skill value for this test.
If this test failed:
Thrown completely off-center, you nearly lose your footing and are forced to jettison equipment to keep stable.
Each investigator at this location discards an asset they control. The performing investigator returns an additional asset they control to their hand. Proceed to If this test succeeded.
If this test succeeded:
You push through the disorienting climb to the pillar's base, building up your fortitude once more to force a load-bearing stone out of position.
Discard each card attached to this location and move this card to the victory display. Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Ruins of R'lyeh.

cards.name: Impossible Pillar
cards.text:
Impossible Pillar is connected to each other location with the same orientation as itself, and vice versa.
[action] Remove 2 horror from among other locations with the same orientation as Impossible Pillar: Discover a clue from Impossible Pillar.
[free] If there are no clues on Impossible Pillar: Flip it and resolve the story text on its other side.

cards.name: The Fragmented Pillar
cards.text:
This pillar is far more scattered than the others, existing in several overlapping dimensions at once. You must travel between the same spaces and find where the base truly lies.
Choose an investigator at this location to test [willpower] + [agility] (4). This test gets +2[per_investigator] difficulty. An investigator at this location may exhaust Warped Idol or Immutable Sigil to give +2 skill value for this test.
If this test failed:
You can barely hold yourself together as you trudge through the twisted landscape, leaving bits as you go.
Each investigator at this location loses 2 resources. The performing investigator loses 2 additional resources. Proceed to If this test succeeded.
If this test succeeded:
You finally navigate to a point where each of the dimensions overlaps, and are able to vandalize the section of the pillar warping space around itself.
Discard each card attached to this location and move this card to the victory display. Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Ruins of R'lyeh.

cards.name: Impossible Pillar
cards.text:
Impossible Pillar is connected to each other location with the same orientation as itself, and vice versa.
[action] Remove 2 horror from among other locations with the same orientation as Impossible Pillar: Discover a clue from Impossible Pillar.
[free] If there are no clues on Impossible Pillar: Flip it and resolve the story text on its other side.

cards.name: The Arcane Pillar
cards.text:
An additional protective ward surrounds this pillar, wracking the bodies of anyone who approaches. You will have to withstand this power as you work to unravel the seal around it.
Choose an investigator at this location to test [intellect] + [combat] (4). This test gets +2[per_investigator] difficulty. An investigator at this location may exhaust Warped Idol or Immutable Sigil to give +2 skill value for this test.
If this test failed:
Eldritch energy flows through your body as you try to divert it away from the pillar, scoring your brain.
Each investigator at this location discards a card from their hand at random. The performing investigator discards an additional card at random. Proceed to If this test succeeded.
If this test succeeded:
You gradually grow familiar with the ebb and flow of the energy and divert it back at the pillar itself, tearing away a considerable chunk of stone in the process.
Discard each card attached to this location and move this card to the victory display. Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Ruins of R'lyeh.

cards.name: Impossible Pillar
cards.text:
Impossible Pillar is connected to each other location with the same orientation as itself, and vice versa.
[action] Remove 2 horror from among other locations with the same orientation as Impossible Pillar: Discover a clue from Impossible Pillar.
[free] If there are no clues on Impossible Pillar: Flip it and resolve the story text on its other side.

cards.name: The Veiled Pillar
cards.text:
The distortions of reality have hidden this pillar in a labyrinth of bent space. It will take considerable time and concentration to properly navigate through.
Choose an investigator at this location to test [intellect] + [agility] (4). This test gets +2[per_investigator] difficulty. An investigator at this location may exhaust Warped Idol or Immutable Sigil to give +2 skill value for this test.
If this test failed:
The diverging paths lead you through repetitive cycles and dead ends that tax your psyche with each fault.
Each investigator at this location discards the top three cards of their deck. The performing investigator discards an additional two cards and draws each weakness discarded. Proceed to If this test succeeded.
If this test succeeded:
The bent realities finally converge at the base of the pillar, giving you the opportunity to find and deface the most crucial carvings.
Discard each card attached to this location and move this card to the victory display. Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Ruins of R'lyeh.

cards.name: Impossible Pillar
cards.text:
Impossible Pillar is connected to each other location with the same orientation as itself, and vice versa.
[action] Remove 2 horror from among other locations with the same orientation as Impossible Pillar: Discover a clue from Impossible Pillar.
[free] If there are no clues on Impossible Pillar: Flip it and resolve the story text on its other side.

cards.name: The Guarded Pillar
cards.text:
Space around this pillar is strangely normal, but it lies nestled amid jagged rock ledges and treacherous chasms. This trek will push your body to its limit.
Choose an investigator at this location to test [combat] + [agility] (4). This test gets +2[per_investigator] difficulty. An investigator at this location may exhaust Warped Idol or Immutable Sigil to give +2 skill value for this test.
If this test failed:
Several times, your footing slips and the looming terrain crushes down on you, battering your body terribly.
Each investigator at this location takes 1 damage. The performing investigator takes 1 additional damage. Proceed to If this test succeeded.
If this test succeeded:
You press on through the hazardous landscape, finally making your way to the sturdy pillar. From there, it is a thankfully simple matter of leverage to dislodge its keystone.
Discard each card attached to this location and move this card to the victory display. Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Ruins of R'lyeh.

cards.name: Impossible Pillar
cards.text:
Impossible Pillar is connected to each other location with the same orientation as itself, and vice versa.
[action] Remove 2 horror from among other locations with the same orientation as Impossible Pillar: Discover a clue from Impossible Pillar.
[free] If there are no clues on Impossible Pillar: Flip it and resolve the story text on its other side.

cards.name: Cthulhu
cards.text: Massive. Cthulhu may be evaded with [willpower]. Forced - When you would evade Cthulhu: It does not exhaust. Instead, flip the Inescapable Reach card matching your location's orientation facedown. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, flip each copy of Inescapable Reach facedown.

cards.name: Inescapable Reach (Up)
cards.text: Revelation - Put Inescapable Reach (Up) into play next to the agenda deck. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. Inescapable Reach (Up) cannot leave play. Cthulhu is considered to be at each location that is oriented Up. [reaction] At the start of the investigator phase, place 1 doom on Cthulhu: Flip each copy of Inescapable Reach facedown. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

cards.name: Inescapable Reach (Left)
cards.text: Revelation - Put Inescapable Reach (Left) into play next to the agenda deck. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. Inescapable Reach (Left) cannot leave play. Cthulhu is considered to be at each location that is oriented Left. [reaction] At the start of the investigator phase, place 1 doom on Cthulhu: Flip each copy of Inescapable Reach facedown. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

cards.name: Inescapable Reach (Right)
cards.text: Revelation - Put Inescapable Reach (Right) into play next to the agenda deck. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. Inescapable Reach (Right) cannot leave play. Cthulhu is considered to be at each location that is oriented Right. [reaction] At the start of the investigator phase, place 1 doom on Cthulhu: Flip each copy of Inescapable Reach facedown. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

cards.name: Inescapable Reach (Down)
cards.text: Revelation - Put Inescapable Reach (Down) into play next to the agenda deck. This effect cannot be canceled or ignored. Inescapable Reach (Down) cannot leave play. Cthulhu is considered to be at each location that is oriented Down. [reaction] At the start of the investigator phase, place 1 doom on Cthulhu: Flip each copy of Inescapable Reach facedown. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

cards.name: Damned Dreamer
cards.text: Hunter. Alert. Forced - After Damned Dreamer attacks you: Rotate your investigator mini-card 90 degrees counter-clockwise.

cards.name: Deep Progeny
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Investigators engaged with Deep Progeny get –1 to each of their skills while the orientation of their investigator mini-card does not match their location's orientation. Forced - After Deep Progeny engages you: Rotate your investigator mini-card 90 degrees counter-clockwise.

cards.name: Incalculable Angles
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and gains peril if the orientation of your investigator mini-card does not match your location's orientation. If you fail, take 1 damage and move to a connecting location.

cards.name: Inconceivable Vistas
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, take 1 horror and rotate your investigator mini-card 90 degrees counter-clockwise. If you fail by 2 or more, rotate your investigator mini-card an additional 90 degrees counter-clockwise.

cards.name: World Turning On End
cards.text: Revelation - If this is the first copy of World Turning On End drawn this round, rotate each investigator mini-card 180 degrees. Otherwise, World Turning On End gains surge.

cards.name: Archaic Evils
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. You must either (choose one): - Draw each weakness revealed and remove eachother revealed card from the game. - Shuffle each revealed card back into your deck.Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effectcan cause the current agenda to advance.

cards.name: Eldritch Geometer
cards.text: Spawn - Any connecting location (empty if possible). While Eldritch Geometer is in play, reduce the modifier of each [cultist], [tablet], and [elder_thing] token by 1. (Example: --2 becomes --3.)

cards.name: Mad Architect
cards.text: Aloof. Spawn - Location connected to the most other locations without another Mad Architect. Each location connected to Mad Architect's location gains "Non-Euclidean – Place 1 doom on Mad Architect."

cards.name: Hyperbolic Sigils
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Hyperbolic Sigils to the location with the highest shroud value that does not have Hyperbolic Sigils attached. Attached location gains "Non-Euclidean – Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a weakness, draw it. Otherwise, discard it." [action]: Test [willpower] (0). Reveal X chaos tokens, where X is the amount you succeeded by. If you reveal a [bless] or [curse] token, reveal another token. If you reveal 1 or more [tablet] and/or [elder_sign] tokens, discard Hyperbolic Sigils.

cards.flavor:
"...the dreams of sensitive men assumed a heightened vividness and darkened with dread of a giant monster’s malign pursuit..."
--- H. P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthluhu
cards.name: Delusional Dreamer
cards.text: Hunter. Spawn - Engaged with prey. Prey - Investigator with the most encounter cards in their hand. Forced - After Delusional Dreamer engages you: Take 1 damage or 1 horror for each encounter card in your hand.

cards.name: Grotesque Hallucinations
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - If you end your turn at a location with a shroud value of 3 or higher: Reveal Grotesque Hallucinations and discard a card from your hand at random. [action] Choose a non-weakness card in your discard pile and remove it from the game: Discard Grotesque Hallucinations.

cards.name: Counterassault
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Counterassault into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When a Guardian ([guardian]) investigator would play a card: Increase that card's cost by 1. [action] Take 1 direct damage: Place 1 resource on Counterassault from the token bank. Only Guardian ([guardian]) investigators may take this action. Then, if there are a number of resources on Counterassault equal to the number of Guardian ([guardian]) investigators in the game, discard Counterassault.

cards.name: Counterbalance
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Counterbalance into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - Each Neutral investigator cannot play or activate an ability on a non-Neutral player card more than once per phase. [action] Discard a non-Neutral card from your hand or from play: Place 1 resource on Counterbalance from the token bank. Only Neutral investigators may take this action. Then, if there are a number of resources on Counterbalance equal to the number of Neutral investigators in the game, discard Counterbalance.

cards.name: Countereffort
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Countereffort into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After a Survivor ([survivor]) investigator fails a test: That investigator loses an action. [action] Place 2 cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck: Place 1 resource on Countereffort from the token bank. Only Survivor ([survivor]) investigators may take this action. Then, if there are a number of resources on Countereffort equal to the number of Survivor ([survivor]) investigators in the game, discard Countereffort.

cards.name: Counterforce
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Counterforce into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After a Mystic ([mystic]) investigator resolves a [willpower] test during his or her turn: That investigator takes 1 horror. [action] Take 1 direct horror: Place 1 resource on Counterforce from the token bank. Only Mystic ([mystic]) investigators may take this action. Then, if there are a number of resources on Counterforce equal to the number of Mystic ([mystic]) investigators in the game, discard Counterforce.

cards.name: Counterintelligence
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Counterintelligence into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After a Seeker ([seeker]) investigator discovers any amount of clues: That investigator discards a card from his or her hand at random. [action] Place 1 of your clues on your location: Place 1 resource on Counterintelligence from the token bank. Only Seeker ([seeker]) investigators may take this action. Then, if there are a number of resources on Counterintelligence equal to the number of Seeker ([seeker]) investigators in the game, discard Counterintelligence.

cards.name: Counterplay
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Counterplay into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When a Rogue ([rogue]) investigator would gain any amount of resources outside the upkeep phase: That investigator gains 1 fewer resource. [action] Spend 3 resources: Place 1 resource on Counterplay from the token bank. Only Rogue ([rogue]) investigators may take this action. Then, if there are a number of resources on Counterplay equal to the number of Rogue ([rogue]) investigators in the game, discard Counterplay.

cards.name: Lucid Worshipper
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - While you are engaged with Lucid Worshipper and any amount of non-weakness cards enter your discard pile: Remove 1 of those cards from the game. Forced - After Lucid Worshipper attacks you: Discard the top card of your deck.

cards.name: Iä! Iä!
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Iä! Iä! to the current agenda. Forced - At the end of the round, the investigators must decide (choose one): - Add 1 doom to the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Each investigator discards the top 3 cards of his or her deck and draws each weakness discarded. [action]: Test [willpower] (5). This test gets --1 difficulty for every 5 cards in your discard pile. If you succeed, discard Iä! Iä!.

cards.name: Abyssal Visions
cards.text: Revelation - Put Abyssal Visions into play in your threat area. Forced - When you would reveal chaos tokens for a test you are performing: Reveal an additional token and cancel the token with the highest modifier. The [auto_fail] token is considered to be lower than each other token. (Limit once per test.) Forced - At the end of the round, discard Abyssal Visions.

cards.name: Corrupting Influence (Compulsion)
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When a [cultist] or [elder_thing] token is revealed during a test performed by any investigator (choose one): - That test automatically fails. Then, discard Corrupting Influence (Compulsion). - Reveal Corrupting Influence (Compulsion) and take 1 damage.

cards.name: Corrupting Influence (Strain)
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When a [cultist] or [elder_thing] token is revealed during a test performed by any investigator (choose one): - That test automatically fails. Then, discard Corrupting Influence (Strain). - Reveal Corrupting Influence (Strain) and take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: You know too much.
cards.name: Fixer
cards.text:
Hunter. Retaliate.
If there is a [[Countermeasure]] treachery in play that matches the class of an investigator at Fixer's location, Fixer gets +1 fight and alert.

cards.flavor: Nothing to see here.
cards.name: Spook
cards.text: Aloof. Spawn - Location with the most clues without another Spook (with Victory X if possible). Clues cannot be discovered from Spook's location. If there are no clues on Spook's location, it loses aloof, gains hunter and gets +1 fight.

cards.name: Around Every Corner
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, the nearest [[Conspirator]] enemy moves directly to your location and makes an immediate attack against you. If there are no [[Conspirator]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for one and spawn it engaged with you. If there is a [[Countermeasure]] treachery in play that matches your class, you cannot commit cards to this test.

cards.name: Deep One Raider
cards.text: Hunter. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Forced - After Deep One Raider is successfully evaded: Move Deep One Raider to a connecting location (empty if possible).

cards.name: Hybrid Infiltrator
cards.text: Aloof. Patrol (location with the highest shroud). Spawn - Location with the lowest shroud. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase, if Hybrid Infiltrator is at a location with 3 or higher shroud value: Place 1 doom on Hybrid Infiltrator.

cards.name: Out of Murky Darkness
cards.text: Revelation - Put Out of Murky Darkness into play in your threat area. Forced - After you enter a location: Each [[Deep One]] or [[Hybrid]] enemy already at that location makes an immediate attack against you. (Limit once per phase). [action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Out of Murky Darkness.

cards.name: Battering Waves
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage and move to the connecting location with the lowest shroud value. If there is a difference of 2 or more between the shroud values of the two locations, also lose 1 action.

cards.name: Driving Rain
cards.text: Revelation - Put Driving Rain into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When an investigator would take a move or investigate action during his or her turn: That investigator loses 1 resource. Forced - At the end of the round, discard a copy of Driving Rain. (Max once per round)

cards.flavor:
Maybe he's hiding something.
Or maybe he just doesn't like your face.
cards.name: Wharf Rat
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. Before revealing tokens, you may spend 2 resources to reveal an additional token and ignore one of them. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token, Wharf Rat readies, engages, and attacks you. If you reveal any other token, discard Wharf Rat. If you reveal a +1 or [elder_sign] token, also discover a clue at your location.

cards.name: Street Brawl
cards.text: Revelation - Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you fail, take 2 damage and put Street Brawl into play in your threat area. You cannot take parley actions. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Street Brawl.

cards.name: "You'd better leave..."
cards.text: Revelation - Attach "You'd better leave..." to the revealed location with the most clues that does not already have a copy of "You'd better leave..." attached. Forced - After an investigator discovers any amount of clues from the attached location: That investigator must either take 1 damage or lose 1 action. If there are no clues at the attached location, discard "You'd better leave..." [action] Spend 2 resources: Parley. Discard "You'd betterleave..."

cards.flavor:
"...Johansen swears he was swallowed up by an angle of masonry which shouldn’t have been there; an angle which was acute, but behaved as if it were obtuse."
--- H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthluhu
cards.name: Dimensional Fold
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (X), where X is the shroud value of your location. If you fail, take 1 damage and discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If you fail by 2 or more, draw each weakness discarded.

cards.name: Impossible Perspective
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror and put Impossible Perspective into play in your threat area. Your maximum hand size is reduced by 2. Forced - After you discard 2 or more cards during upkeep: Discard Impossible Perspective.

cards.name: Warped Stonework
cards.text: Revelation - If there is no copy of Warped Stonework attached to your location, attach Warped Stonework to your location. Otherwise, Warped Stonework gains surge. Attached location gains "Non-Euclidean – Instead, take 1 damage or 1 horror (choose one) and move directly to a location that is not connected to the attached location." [action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Discard Warped Stonework.
